I explained to her that we did not hear her because we were being shuffled around by their staff from counter to counter. She replied by telling me that she didn’t believe that I didn’t hear her and continued to criticize me further. She took zero accountability for their incompetent staff. We ended up missing our flight and had to rebook another flight. Later I returned to her counter to get her name so I could file a report but the staff acted dumb and told me they didn’t know her name. I then asked to speak to a supervisor and was told it was his day off?! None of the staff members wear name tags. We will never travel AirAsia again!

I booked return flights Bandung - Singapore on 5th September 2022. I subsequently received an email from AirAsia on 15 October telling me that my flights were cancelled due to 'Operational reasons'. A promise is made for the refund to be made in 30 days. Now more than a month later, the refund is still in progress and no further advisories to enlighten me the status .... except from what I see in my account on their website. AirAsia has no customer service, no customer service phone number, not even an email address. All they have is an online chatbot named AVA, which is worse than useless. So you are on your own should any problems arise after you confirm your booking. Will definitely avoid flying AirAsia if I had a choice.

The worst airline I have ever dealt with. They would not allow me to book a pre-flight bag and then charged me $80 for a bag that was slightly overweight (10 kilos). I had no choice but to pay as I was on the way to the flight. They were totally disinterested in helping. Terrible experience all around.

When the return flight was changed to another time, I had the option to change the date/flight to a new one. And I tried to do this, in the process to change it seems it doesn’t work and I get no confirmation email of the change. But so I find out they make up a new email which I have to register with on airasia website or some bullshit! So the ticket was changed and when it was time to check in for this flight, I also didn’t see any email to my own email and I lost my flight. Customer service is only a robot, and no phone number to customers support picks up the phone.

The worst flight! Of course was delayed! There was an accident with one of the passengers, help was provided late and because AirAsia are not providing stickers with the passenger details to the bags etc.. it took another 30-40 mins to find the bag of the passenger that was removed from the flight. Everyone was shocked and panicked, when I requested water after an accident it wasn’t provided, you have to buy it! Just ridiculous! Flight was 3 hours + and with all the delays we were in the airplane for more than 4-5 hours! Customer service is as low as it could be. Not talking about how uncomfortable and tight the seats was.

According their check in process, they mentioned we able start online check 14 days before departure. However, in reality is 10 days before. They should make the correction. Flight return from Krabi to Kuala Lumpur, most of the inflight meal was sold out. Cabin crew mentioned only left “ Nasi Lemak option”. When they make this announcement flight already on sky of Selangor. I don’t know what the purpose they make announcement of food sold out when the flight prepare for landing. They should bring more food since they notice no restaurant operate in international terminal. A320 Neo seat is suck. Not comfortable.
Nice, uneventful short flight, clean aircraft, super nice crew. Left on time, arrived on time. Only "negative"? Parked a bit far away from arrival at DMK.

Never again with AirAsia. I wish I could have given it 0 stars. This is coming from a loyal customer during pre-pandemic days. This airline unfortunately never recovered from the pandemic. Both sectors (inbound and outbound flights) were delayed by more than 1.5 hours. Finally landed in the domestic terminal and was ushered by a bus to go to international, before walking all the way to immigration, and then had to wait for luggage. Absolutely horrible and ruined my day/week.

route: Penang to Danang via Kuala Lumpur
review: My wife has problems with her knees and has great difficulty with stairs so we notified the person at the counter, they asked can she do stairs, I said no she can not. They said ok and charged us for wheelchair. Then she had a wheelchair brought and said I was to push it. I declined and she sent for someone. We had a layover in Kuala Lumpur and when it was time to board no wheelchair, and a long ramp and then she had to climb stairs anyway. When we arrived in Danang again no wheelchair. And nowhere to contact customer service to get our money back. Never again.

My flight was suppose to be at 4.35 pm on 31/10/22. The flight got delayed to 5.50 pm. So I waited. After half an hour the flight got delayed another time to 6.40 pm. Isn't this ridiculous? We need to be there 2 hours before departure and the flight is delayed than 2 hours. I for one did not have enough currency to buy any food  and I was like super hungry.. by the time I reached KL I was starving.  This was a very bad experience for me. The cabin crew was so unfriendly, never even greet the customers when they enter, busy talking to themselves.

First of all I understand that AirAsia is a low fare airline but doesn’t mean that whatever that this airline management’s doing is right where I flew in this airline so many times and never flew on the time of they advertised initially when purchasing the ticket. We purchase the tickets suits our occasions but what happen always are rescheduling the flight, over delay and frequently change gates. Due to delay and rescheduling, I can’t attend my event. At least for not disappointing please provide some complimentary drinks for making your customers to wait for so long. Please be responsible on the schedule that advertising initially. After all this is low fare airline not free airline so please respect your customer’s time since we are purchasing tickets too. This is not fair at all where if we as a customer if late for few minutes, will the airline wait for us, no right, so again I’m telling that please respect your customer’s time.

AirAsia has no proper customer support and not able to reach customer care. They have bot AVA with limited options that can't resolve your issues. Due to cheap quality website, I got duplicate ticket for same flight on same date. I raised a ticket and try to follow up with airasia.com in many ways but no luck.

Booking for onward flights were correct, there was enough time to connect in Manila. Then the airline issued a ticket under i0ne booking number and mention connection guaranteed by carrier. Booking for return flight did not alert on any issue for connection. The connecting tine (1 hour and 20 minutes) was too short for immigration formalities and taxi to next place for connecting flight. I tried to reach customer service. After hours waiting for agent i got a brief message: the company had issued 2 booking codes (one for each segment of the itinerary) so it could not guarantee the connection. I had to buy another ticket for the connecting flight, 3 hours later, to be sure I would have time to go through immigration and to take a taxi to go to departure place for connecting flight. AirAsia should not show connecting flights with too short time to connect. It should show flights with at least 3 hours for connection, or it should inform client, when booking a Bangkok to Cebu flight that client will need at least 3 hours for immigration plus transport to second place for connecting flight. It is unfair to let client book and pay flight with insufficient connecting time and then tell client "Sorry there is nothing we can do, yes you are likely to miss the connecting flight, you should buy a new ticket for a later flight".

Absolutely the worst customer service. Can't ever talk to a real person. Tried to cancel due to a medical issue with relative. Did not want a refund but merely a credit towards a future flight when illness over but refused through their automated chat. Again no live person capabilities. The worst airline service experience ever. I would never do business with them again. I'll pay more elsewhere. Beware!

The system auto assigned my 8 yr old daughter to a seat 12 rows from me, which is against the airline's safety policy. When I contacted Customer service to raise my concern, they agreed to move her to a seat close by. But then at airport check in, I couldn't print boarding pass. Was told to go to payment counter and pay for changing my daughter's seat! After escalation, the manager even accused me of putting my daughter in a far away seat but now wants to move her closer, hence I should pay. I find her accusation so ridiculous. She finally agreed to waive seat charge, as though she did me a favor. I wonder why AirAsia system would assign young kids to sit by themselves.  My advise. Go with another airline!

I booked on the airasia.com powered by kiwi.com website and found out today my flight has been moved 6.5hrs earlier to a time I simply cannot make (and makes the journey from Siem Reap to Singapore 13 hours long!). I am now being told I get no refund if I don't fly on it because it would be a 'voluntary' cancellation, and it will cost over $320 dollars more to rebook to a later flight on the same day. I thought maybe after covid the terrible travel services would cease, but I guess Air Asia does not care. Shocking treatment.

Had a flight from Bangkok to Osaka cancelled during COVID. They gave a partial refund but the rest remained as a voucher.  However, using the voucher is next to impossible. In March I wanted to go to Krabi but the voucher didn't work. I contacted the airline and explained the problem but they were so slow in responding that I ran out of time and had to book flights at a higher price and without the discount vouchers. When they finally got back to me they asked for my information and then I never heard from them again and they closed the enquiry without informing me. I'm trying to use the vouchers for another trip. I'm about a week away from when I need to fly and I still haven't been able to book flights because their customer service is so awful. I contacted them months ago via email (after they hung up on me on the phone twice!) and they asked me for my information again. They have so far confirmed that I have vouchers but haven't given me any way to use them either during booking or after booking. Once again I've waited so long that the flights I wanted have disappeared and I'll now be paying a higher price for flights I didn't want. The only way to contact them now is though their terrible online chat which never understands my question. I've managed to get in an online queue but I'm number 99 and have moved one place in about 30 minutes.

I booked this flight on August and AirAsia cancelled it so I had to reschedule. Then when finally came the travel time and I arrived at 7am at the Jakarta station, they told me that the flight to Medan has been rescheduled again this morning for 6pm so around 9 hours later. This was already bad because I booked a trip in Medan so I couldn't make it on time. And I didn't even receive any email or notification about rescheduling. Then around 3pm I got another email saying that the flight has been rescheduled for 1am of the next day. 5 min later I got another message saying the flight has been rescheduled for 1:50am. So 4 times rescheduled, together 16 hours of delay. They gave us ridiculously low amount of money as an excuse. When I started to think about a refund and I tried to book another flight at the same day with another company, AirAsia said that I won't get any refund because I rejected it. Which I did not, they told me about the refund and I said that I have to think about it.

My Bangkok to Phnom Penh flight in October 2022 was rescheduled and I received an email notification of the change of flight time. There was a 7.5-hour change of time, so I decided to cancel my ticket and receive a refund. I couldn't see any option to contact a member of staff, other than a bot on the AirAsia website. Since submitting my claim, I haven't received any correspondence from AirAsia. Luckily, it was a really cheap flight and I can take the loss. I certainly wouldn't book with AsiaAir again because I just wouldn't want to be placed in a similar situation.

route: Phuket to Siem Reap via Bangkok
review: Flight was cancelled more than 2 weeks prior to departure for "Operational reasons". Attempted to secure a refund but it took over 2 weeks just to get a response. AirAsia, decided that, rather than a 5 hour transit, an alternative flight a day later with around 15 hours of travel was a sufficient substitute. Over 3 weeks later and I am still waiting to understand if I will receive a refund. Will never book with AirAsia again.

Worst flight experience ever. Had double booked due to system error. Filed in a refund request for one ticket to AirAsia but seems they don't want to give my money back. The process took so long and no customer service available anywhere to give your complaint directly. D-1 before my scheduled flight, my morning flight got rescheduled to the afternoon without other option available to refund or even reschedule my flight. The system in the check-in terminal is slow. I think the company is facing bankruptcy.

Had a flight 2.9.22 18:55 to Kuala Lumpur - I'm there an hour early - sitting at my Gate 6a it says very clearly 18:55 DPS-KUL AirAsia at the Gate. I go to board they tell me my flight its the other flight at 18:55 AirAsia to Kuala Lumpur at Gate 2 but it’s already left. I go to the other gate explain, they say it’s my fault because I didn’t go to the live checkin. And had I done the online checkin properly I would have seen. This is the text on the online ticket: "you may proceed directly to the gate using this e-boarding pass". The employee said there were tickets available the same day, but until I admitted it was my fault he would not give me one for today but instead for tomorrow.  I have never ever experienced anything close to this. In the end luckily I managed to get a ticket for the same day but had to pay the difference.

I went to my gate entrance for my domestic flight at 2.15 when my flight is at 2.50. At the time, when the officer scanned my boarding pass the machine said "not checked in" even thought I clearly had the boarding pass. The officer said to try again in 5 minutes and the same result kept coming up until 15 minutes had passed and now the result became "too late to board". The officer told me to go to the service counter and they kept sending me to different service counters until I reached the rudest lady who initially told me that I can't board within 20 minutes of take off, even though I was at the gate 35 minutes before take off. I kept begging her to help me but all she said was "please step aside, sir. I'm busy". That was 5 minutes prior to the supposed take off and of course I missed the flight. After all of this I had to go retrieve the bags I checked in and that took over 20 minutes, at which time I found out the flight had been delayed by 40 minutes. I have to wait for the delayed flight to depart before I can take back my checked in bags. What kind of customer service is this? Also I was informed that they may help me with rescheduling the flight if I pay the difference even though 1 AirAsia employee told me it was the system's fault.

Both flights from Jakarta to Penang back to Jakarta had three delays, and they canceled two of our flights, then delayed the final return flight to a 1:40 am departure. It caused us three extra hotel night expenses for a 2.5 hour flight. Horrible communication. We were not even informed of the delay.

I submitted an app check in and it was successfully submitted. I had no check in baggage so I only went to the airport 50min before the flight to print my boarding pass and board the plane. But when i went to the airport it was not reflected on the system and they said I was not checked in and as such cannot check in anymore as counter is closed. The only solution was to buy a new air ticket. And I was not given a choice of seats and was asked to purchase what i later found out to be the most expensive seat on the plane, a hot seat, which I did not ask for. A simple trip air ticket cost doubled and totally ruined my trip.
Good value for money, uneventful short hop from JKT to KUL, early morning. Good value for money regarding pre-ordered meal, easy check-in and clean airplane. Nice crew.

I was weary of this airline because of my previous experience flying in from Manila last July 2022. However ground crew Cheska changed it all. She managed to make our check in from Dumaguete to Manila quick and efficient. Her loyalty and hard work deserves recognition.

Return flights for August 2022, both changed to one that didn't work for me at all. Reason given was that getting me safely to my destination was their highest priority. Rejected the new flights and requested refund via their AVA bot. 3 days later, sent me email confirming the replacement flight booking that i had rejected. No way to contact other than ava bot. Messed up my travel plans and now adding to my problems.

Tried to book a flight through their website. They process my credit card then the next day sent an email stating unsuccessful in the process. But credit card transaction went through. Now to get funds back, it will take 14 to 30 days. The worst customer service I have ever deal with. No support, no phone number or live person to talk with.

Flight was cancelled and retimed multiple times to exceedingly inconvenient timing. It is never okay to retime flights to another time because if it was, then I would have bought the ticket at that time and not the one that I choose. Airasia has no customer service whatsoever. A useless robot is not customer service. Airasia also practices Excessively draconian rules on baggage weight as if an extra 1kg of carry on baggage. Charges customers exorbitantly for baggage, food or any service under the guise of ‘low cost’.

AA has gone from bad to worse, if that is possible! Tried to change flights due to a visa issue but the only form of interaction is with AVA - an auto-bot with limited information. I have been trying to reschedule for over 2 hours now without any success. This is tantamount to fraud and scam - AirAsia is essentially robbing us of our money. I will never book through AirAsia again. If the airline is unable to provide an adequate customer service, the whole outfit should just close shop or sell to a party better able to run the airline. What a waste of money!

I ordered my round-way tickets months in advance, only for them to say my return flight will be canceled one week before the actual flight. I needed to talk to someone to get more detail about the process, but no human is available as their system is now only a bot.  The system offered to move my return flight to another day but none of the proposed timing fit my schedule, so I asked for a refund. I was given a pending case confirmation, without any detail whatsoever on the refund processing.  Since I couldn’t get any clarity, I decided to go down to the airport counter and asked some questions to the ground staff at the AirAsia counter.  She checked and confirmed the refund request was actually for both depart and return tickets, something that is not made clear in the bot chat. The ground staff could not void my refund request as this has to be done by AirAsia and not the airport staff. I had thought that the refund was only going to be for my return ticket but I had lost both tickets. Because of this, they couldn’t guarantee that I will still have my name in the booking system on my departure date. The ground staff said there’s nothing that can be done on their side as they have no way to reach AirAsia. Basically, I need to book another ticket which is way more expensive now that I have so little time left before my flight. So before you book your tickets think twice. It could just be a stroke of bad luck on my side, but I’m reading so many reviews that are similar to mine and they help solidify why I will never book from this airline ever again.

Worst experience ever with an airline when It comes to hassles and changes. Flights from KL to Langkawi delayed. I received an email whilst at the airport getting ready to check in saying delayed. My original return flight from Langkawi to KL was cancel and we were bumped back over 2 hrs to a later flight. Then that flight was delayed after we checked in. Then to add insult to injury, the Air Asia flight going to KL that was scheduled for a later departure ended up flying out before my earlier flight. Then if you try to lodge a complaint about the service it is all virtual response now. Seriously such lousy service and terrible airline. I truly regret booking with Air Asia. Next time I will look for any other airline before I ever book with Air Asia again.

I bought a ticket through AirAsia website for a flight on the 21st of August (Sunday), from Chiang Mai to Kuala Lumpur. I received an email last Saturday, notifying me that the flight had been canceled due to "operational reasons". I tried to understand what these reasons were but I could only contact an automated bot. I eventually got to talk with a so-called live agent (had to wait in queue for 3 hours) that pretended he was typing (the 3 dots pre-message symbol showed up for like 5 minutes) and eventually the conversation "expired". I came to understand that the flight they sold me (AK 857) doesn't operate on Sundays. I have another ticket bought from them, for the 25th August (Thursday), from KL to Krabi (AK 868) and I already checked Flightaware and found out that the flight only operates on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. I asked for a refund for the flight that got cancelled by AirAsia, but so far I haven't got my money back and from the looks of it, I'm understanding that the same situation will arise with the KL to Krabi flight. Don't trust AirAsia flights and always check on several sites if the flights actually exist and operate on the days they are selling them.

Worst experience ever. Will never fly again. All they want is to find a way to charge you extra. Seats are cramped, unprofessional behaviour of the staff, late check in and late arrival, and overall a horrible travel experience. I have flown enough low cost airlines in the world, I would rate Air Asia as the worst ever.

During the flight the food service was suspended right in front of me due to turbulence. Then they resumed it from the back of the cabin, but never came to me. When I called a flight attendant and asked for a meal, she told me that they have run out of it and added "I'm very sorry". Didn't offer even a glass of water. Throughout the whole 2 hr flight I was hungry and mad. I'll never fly AirAsia again.

Tried to buy additional 10 kg baggage from AirAsia website https://www.airasia.com/member/mybookings#tab-flights on 18 June using my credit card. After 3 fail attempts due to my cc wasn’t able to be verified, I gave up. Checked my email the next day before my flight, didn’t receive any email confirmation that my additional 10 kg baggage purchase has been approved. I decided to only bring one check in luggage weight only 19 kg When I checked in in jakarta airport, i was forced to pay Rp. 223,009 for additional 10 kg baggage which transaction wasn’t successful or been confirmed. Tried to ask for my refund from AirAsia customer service at Denpasar airport was told to go through AVA which were very helpful airasia customer service hosted by AI, after waiting waiting for more than an hour, my queue was terminated,  Without email confirmation whether the transaction was successful, they just forced me to pay something you didn’t purchase?

Bangalore to Mumbai. Worst ever experience. No professionalism. Postponing flights and after that also nothing on time. I would never again go by this flight. Why do they write even for departure when they are never going to follow it. So much inconvenience.

route: Bangkok to Kuching via Kuala Lumpur
review: I will never take AirAsia again if there is a choice. Worst ever airlines I have ever experienced. They rescheduled my flight and changed me and my kids' seating from first row (hot seat) to a normal seat in the back row. And there is no refund for this change. I tried to chat in Airasia App multiple times but the only response I got was 'we are experiencing technical issue, please try again later.' It is really frustrating when the planned schedule was simply changed by AirAsia and the seat row (I bought first seat for the comfort of me and my kids as I was travelling without husband) was changed to normal seat. And is there is no refund for this row change.

Really bad airline start to finish. Check in under staffed, no social distance control and rude ground staff. We booked a flight together but when we got our tickets they put us in Seat A and C with gap of middle seat. They told me the flight was full and we had no choice. I pointed out that no one likes to sit in the middle seat, so why not give them the window or aisle, so we as a couple are together. They were rude and says that's our allocated tickets. We will never travel AirAsia again.

Purchased baggage in advance with tickets. Tried to luggage drop exactly an hour before flight time at 11.25am which was stated as 12.25pm. System error stating late. Went to the counter, and was told to queue. Spoke to a couple of other passengers and noticed they are the same flight as me, and machine also stated late and hence unable to luggage drop despite them being there way earlier than 1hr before departure. When queue reaches our turn, its 11.45pm. Counter customer service stated too late, cannot luggage drop. We were told to wait for this flight to depart first, then try to request customer service for change to another flight and pay the difference. That sounds ridiculous because the other passengers are "late" because AirAsia's own ticketing system has a problem and everyone was asked to queue until they missed the closing time for dropping luggage. I gave my luggage to my wife who drove me here and ran all the way to the departure gate. I arrived at the departure gate at 12.10pm. On the way, custom informed me that system shows I cannot board but I can try. Tried I did. To my surprise, the plane is not there yet at the departure gate when I arrived. This means Airaasia could have helped, but they simply refuse. When I tried to reason to the counter at the departure gate, all I get told was I was late. There is no sense of logic in the heads of these customer service agents. In any case, it is now 1.25pm whilst typing this review. 60 minutes delayed with no notice on estimated delay duration. There are the elderly, and kids here and they just don't seem to be bothered. When queried what is the policy for flight delay and possible cancellation, he says 2 hours first, then denies saying it back and forth. Very unprofessional and unreliable customer service. The flight status board now shows another flight, and my flight just simply gets removed without notice, causing alot of passengers crowding at the desk asking what is going on. For reference, we take AirAsia because it is cheaper sometimes. So we understand and do not complaint if it delays a little here and there. However, the customer service is poor beyond reasoning even after taking into account the slightly cheaper rates.

They change our flight from 6.30pm to 8.45pm without proper informing. We waited at airport for 4hours and went on board by 8pm plus until 930pm we been ask to go down and until now 11pm,we are still at Kuala Lumpur. We suppose be arrived by 9pm and change to 11pm and now 11pm, I'm still here. No apology to the passenger. Not only that, the seat arm rest are broken and stick with cloth tape.

route: Kuala Lumpur to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur
review: This has got to be the worst airline in the history of aviation industry. Absolutely apathetic ground crew, and there is zero understanding of customer service concept. You get what you pay for - cheap airlines, cheap service, and I would never have taken this airline except that it was the only direct flight to Bali. Other airlines are twice as expensive, and glad to spend that money to interact with humans. Air Asia service is like a glorified AI BOT.

Disappointing flight. I haven’t flown AirAsia for some time and seems like it’s punctuality and service have gone downhill. The flight was delayed by 2 hours. I wasn’t informed when I checked in at the airport despite at that point the preceding flights were delayed so they should have been aware. Still no apology for being late when they stated they were "boarding" which they stated before the preceding flight had started to disembark. An hour after "boarding" they finally opened up the doors for us to get on. Still no apology, little checking of peoples tickets. Once we get on the plane it’s pretty clear they haven’t even done a cursory clean which is pretty shocking given the lessons of covid. KL T2 is not a great airport to be stuck in past the security barriers for over 2 hours. So if your flying Air Asia I recommend double checking your flight status before doing that. Or just don’t fly AirAsia and maybe you won’t have the same risk of long delays and poor service.

I used to travel frequently with AirAsia but recently the service is getting worse. More than half of my flight got cancelled / rescheduled to the inconvenient time. I need to rearrange my schedule and travel plan because of that. There is no proper way to complain as you will always be directed to AVA which can't settle your issue most of the time. Questions never be answered and customer service is basically not exist. Undeniable it offers the most affordable flight ticket but with the inconvenience caused by frequent reschedule/ cancellation and the worst customer service, it is not worthy of it.

Be very careful with AirAsia, we booked an flight and after once changing our timings from Air Asia they just canceled our flight. We have to book another airline to get to our vacation, of course much more expensive. There was flights from AirAsia available but they didn't offer us. So now they are not paying the money back, they hold it on the air Asia credit account. I try to get my money back but AirAsia refuse to pay back.

We have had a terrible experience with Air Asia. Three weeks before our flights, we received notification that they had cancelled both of our flights for operational reasons. We were automatically rebooked on flights - one of which was an entire day later than our initial itinerary. We couldn't miss the day of work, so attempted to get a refund or credit for that fllight. Absolutely no ability to contact a human, and everything was done through the chat bot - except that the bot was obviously incapable of understanding the situation. We explicitly said we needed a refund for one flight. In the meantime, we booked quickly with another airline (at substantial out of pocket cost). Instead? No refund, but they credited both flights which meant that we now no longer had any route to our destination! We also can't rebook the original AirAsia flight because the price has quadrupled. Absolutely no customer service or assistance. We are left with three lots of flights we can't use, a substantial amount of out of pocket cost, and no apology.

route: Tiruchirappalli to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur
review: The worst ground service by the staff in Trichy airport. I had only hand luggage with my laptop and chargers in my laptop bag which total was 9.1 kg, I was asked to pay for 2.1 kg of a total sum of Rs.6772/- i was made to wait and i was the last passenger to get my boarding pass for my flight. Since when was the laptop started to get in to total weight of the luggage. (if so why didn't they ask to weigh my 2 phones which i was carrying in my pocket, which would add another 1/2 kg for them to charge me ).

Worst customer service. I have waited for hours (5) to get through a live person and each time (3 times) the person closed the chat before I could ask a question. Delayed service, faulty planes, cancelled flights, no refund.  They completely and utterly destroyed my holiday. Shameful airline.

Booked an expensive flight during Eid weekend. Checked in more than 4 hours before flight only to find out the flight is full. App told me to come to the airport early only to put me on a flight 5 hours earlier than my actual flight. No compensation, nothing. Front desk did not even tell me I would not get on the same flight. Why overbook a flight during a major holiday? Why do customers just get pushed to any flight they want without prior notice nor without compensation? I’ve travelled with other budget airlines and this is just the worst. Also, customer service is bad. I can’t even file a complaint. Front desk says all complaints need to go through their online chat Ava. Well, Ava is not human and doesn’t understand simple keywords like “refund” and “compensation”. The worst.

Two years ago I had to cancel my flight to Bali from Perth due to the pandemic. I was "approved" a full refund from AirAsia ($700+) and told to be patient as they understandably were busy with refunds. I have regularly tried to follow this up since then, each time being told to be patient. I have not been able to contact them since October last year and my last communication said that they could not find the booking number! Terrible customer service and I have the feeling that the refund will not happen. Do not use this airline.

Booking a flight from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur on 11th March and received a booking failure notice. Proceed with my booking on other airline and got my ticket. Suddenly on 24th March, received another email stated my previous booking was confirmed. Requested a refund but was being rejected. Were forced to chat with the all-star agent after waited for hours but wasn't helpful at all. No other avenue to get back my money.

I've bought a return ticket from them 12th April depart, 14th April return. They cancelled the departing flight 5 days prior, the next day I got an email says that they have rescheduled my departing flight to 14th April without my consent. That makes my itinerary like departing in the morning, stay at the destination for 30minutes then returning on the same day!? I lodged a case for refund with AirAsia thru their online chat bot, as I couldn't contact any of their customer service staff. My case status was closed by AirAsia, and I haven't get my refund back. I went to the airport to check with their counter staff, they said AirAsia have refunded me. I checked with my bank, and there are not a single dime from AirAsia.  There are no way to contact their person in charge for refund. The boarding counter staffs tell you to lodge your case online with the chatbot. You can spend 2 hours and get nowhere there.

An abysmal customer service experience. Trying to reach a person for help is nearly impossible, they force you to communicate solely via chat with an automated bot that is of very little help. If you are persistent, you can get through to what they lead you to believe is a human but I have my doubts. They have no interest in attempting to retain a customer in any way shape or form, the default answer is no. I was unable to make a booked flight due to rapidly changing travel plans during Covid times. I hoped I could get some kind of credit for booking another flight but they were unwilling to consider the option, which is certainly their right for the fare booked. One would figure they may have some kind of repeat customer loyalty flexibility or the ability to provide any shred of empathy, but that is clearly not the case. Lesson learned, avoid this airline at all costs.

Indonesia AirAsia is the worst airline ever. We had to board the airplane early, just to have wait in the bus, with the air conditioners off and doors wide open in 32 degree weather for a whole 40 minutes. Without any explanation whatsoever on what’s happening.

I haven’t even flown with this company yet and there is already a problem. I booked a flight via AirAsia web site and the payment was rejected. I booked the same flight via another agent. 2 hours later, I found out that the initial payment had already been taken out of my account. Nil customer service.
Sibu to Kuala Lumpur. Worst ever airline services on earth. From top to ground level. Arrogant ground staff and arrogance flight attendance. Terrible, terrible, terrible.

Absolutely horrendous. Don’t bother flying with AirAsia. I bought my ticket on Trip.com. I was denied boarding at the check-in counter by AirAsia, who claimed that I had cancelled my ticket on Trip.com and was already given a full refund. None of that is true. This is a non-refundable and exchangeable ticket to begin with. My ticket was still valid. I was not allowed to check in and was given zero information on what’s going on. Trip.com has confirmed with me there are no refund applications made and I should be allowed to fly. I was informed by Trip.com the next day that AirAsia had rescheduled my flight for the weekend. However, I do not have any ticket issued by AirAsia and no confirmation from them. I have emailed them but received no response. I have queued for over an hour on their online customer service chat support but was kicked out of the queue because "the line is too busy". Trip.com do not have any tickets confirmation either and this entire thing is a question mark. I’m just stuck in Malaysia Kuching right now with no answers, horrible service and attitude from AirAsia and a big hole in my wallet for all the money spent. AirAsia had already delayed my flight by 2 days before this situation happened. I had already rebooked and paid for another hotel, and took another pre-departure Covid test again. Now I’m faced with this question mark and likely have to spend more money and time. This will be my last time flying with AirAsia. Do not even bother to consider them. It’s not worth the supposedly low-ticket prices. You need to do something AirAsia.

Booked flight in April 2020 was canceled obviously because of corona no problem. However for months trying to get either a refund or credit and it is impossible to contact a human. Their super app says that the booking number is incorrect it is what they gave me ? All you do is talk to a bot tried email no reply only phone number person said they don’t do it and wouldn’t give another number or any help. Left comments on their FB no reply and currently AirAsia doesn’t fly to Ho Chi Minh so can’t even go to airport to talk to a ticket agent. The office they had closed two years ago so right now I literally can’t talk to a human to get a refund. Will just have to kiss the money goodbye, I will never use this company again, why would anyone considering if you have any problems of any kind you can’t talk to a customer service rep. Obviously this company has major financial problems.

Received an email notifying my inbound flight cancelled, offered following day flight which was not possible due to hotel bookings and appointments made, so I need to book another flight from another airline. Tried to get refund from AirAsia, discovered no other options except to use it's AVA robotic chat, which was not really user-friendly, and persistently keeps pushing credit rather then cash refund, I persisted, finally left on queue for agent chat, waited approx 45mins, suddenly AVA says not available, call back later! Called back later, waited another 1hr15mins, agent came on, says AA don't give cash refund even if AA cancels flights and copy pasted bits of their t&C's all over chat with link. I followed link to AA's full t&C's, which gave three options when flights are cancelled, and option C clearly stated; full refund to the bank account. So I pointed this out to agent, and copy pasted that paragraph in chat for her perusal. Agent replied; doesn't apply to domestic flights. I asked her to please show me where that is stated as I can't see it mentioned. Agent rudely left chat. I've always used AirAsia prior to this incident but now, I must say I find AirAsia unprofessional unethical business acumen is deplorable, and the unnecessarily rude attitude and rather childish mannerism of its agent totally unwarranted and uncalled for.

The airline keeps cancelling flight especially when the flight date is near. This is without regard to the trouble the passenger will have in rescheduling work leave, rebooking local flight in country of destination, and the expenses of finding another flight from other airlines because their (AirAsia) new flight date will come after 1 month. This happens when COVID cases are already going down and the restrictions already eased, especially in the destination country. The only explanation they can give is "this normally happens".

After repeatedly trying to do an online web check we couldn't. We reached the airport, asked the staff to help us out since we were running out of time.. The lady at the counter said you have to do it on our own. It was just not happening. Finally she tells us the portal is closed so need to pay for the tickets. Next we asked for tags to lock our bags. That was unavailable and she tells us.

I travelled in Thailand with AirAsia, and this time was my worst experience ever. First, they cancelled my flight 3 times. Every time it was a few days before the flight, it cost me more than $300. They've always refused to refund me. You have to know that when you want to get a refund, no "real customer service". You can chat with a bot (which is totally dysfunctional) that always repeats the same garbage. Many people have been waiting for more than one year, never saw they money back. Second, some of their practices are very dubious. When I booked my flight, it was written "check bag included". But when I printed the ticket, I discovered it wasn't and the employee fined me for my luggage (more than 200 USD) because according to the company, it wasn't "included". Actually, when I ordered on their platform, the luggage were included, but the ticket they sent me didn't correspond to reality. I met other travelers when I was queuing up who had the same problem and were fined as well. (No refund/no exchange is possible). To conclude, you should stay away from this low-cost company which has no respect for their customers. They won't hesitate to cancel your flight, charge you extra fees and never refund you. It might be better to take a more expensive company, but more respectful toward consumers.

Absolutely appalling customer service. My flight was cancelled and I was told I would get a refund. Literally years later my case was closed with no explanation. Finally got hold a human through live chat to be told my refund has been rejected. Again no explanation.

Airline cancelled my flight and refused to give refund. Instead it offered some "points" that (maybe) I can use for my next flight. I do not expect to fly with these cheaters any more, so points are pointless. Same as if a customer pay me for a bed in my furniture shop, but I will tell him "sorry, I am out of stock, but I will keep your money and may be one day you can come and buy something else". Terrible.

Cancelled my flight for three times, refuse to refund. I had to pay $148 for overweight fine, but it's not like I had too much of an overweight. AirAsia fine me this much for not even two kilos of luggage, but show no apology when cancelling my flight for 3 times? That's really absurd.

This is a very bad airline, they canceled my flight and did not refund me. I've wasted so much time and energy contacting them trying to get my money back, but it seems that scam customers is part of their business. Stay away from AirAsia!

AirAsia you owe me money. In January 2019 I purchased six tickets from Manila to Cebu and back. When I arrived in Manila, March 2019 you canceled our flights. I have been 2 years trying to get my money back. I have gone through everything that you wanted me to. I have given you all of the information and I have contacted you hundreds of times. I have had conversations with your useless staff. I have given you bank account information to deposit the money that you took within minutes when I purchased the ticket and yet you cannot give me a refund. I have photographs of all of these conversations as well as a photograph of the policy that you had when I purchased my tickets. And that is that if you canceled my flight I was entitled to a full refund to the exact form of payment used to buy the tickets. I have pictures of your agent saying that I should have a refund. You cheat people out of their hard-earned money. We purchased our tickets in good faith and you did not provide the service. There are thousands like me.

Flight cancelled many times, they now didn't add customer service call. Even they have AVA but its harder to some people to reach the staff, can't refund money unless you agree to convert it into credit account.
Worst of the worst. Flights of Air Asia are always retimed and delayed. This airline company don't care about customer's feedback and discomfort. Very disappointing, I don't recommend this to anyone.

Worst customer service ever. Last year, May 2020, our flight got cancelled due to COVID. Our refund request was validated. However, we still haven't received the refund. All other flights - different airlines - have refunded our money. A few weeks ago, there was light at the end of the tunnel - at least, we thought so - as we received an e-mail in which we were asked to provide our bank details so that we could finally get back our money. Note: it was explicitly stated that we had to reply within 7 days, which is odd as AirAsia does not reply to us at all. I have been trying to get in touch with an actual human-being for over a year now. Facebook, website chat, WhatsApp, all you get is AVA the chat bot. I provide them with my case number, my personal details and all I get is 'I am sorry, we could not find your details in our system', which is complete lies. I understand that the world has changed due to COVID, but all organizations seem to have adapted by now. I simply want to speak to a human-being to ask them about my refund request. Sure thing, I will never fly again with AirAsia. Short-term thinking, AirAsia.

Flight for March 2020 was changed and they offered us a refund which we accepted. Wasn’t a cancelled flight to do with covid or anything. It’s now been three months since I gave my bank details and was told my refund was validated and still don’t have the money back, 15 months since the flight. Also since this point it has been impossible to speak to a human being. Emails sent to addresses we once got replies on are being ignored, they have stopped responding to Twitter DMs. Their chatbot is the biggest waste of time and energy. It eventually gives you a choice to provide feedback and that someone will contact you back during work hours only for you to fill it all out and then be told it cannot be completed due to overwhelming volume. When we check the case status it says in progress despite being told it was validated in March 2021. Other airlines refunded within weeks. We’ve been waiting 15 months. I will never fly with Air Asia for as long as I live. When we were getting responses from “customer service representatives” we were met with hostility or else overly polite apologies which mean absolutely nothing to people such as us who are left out of pocket.  Having the audacity to make it impossible to even speak with a human is disgusting.

I booked & paid to fly KL to Manila in May 2020. AirAsia cancelled (Covid)  so i started the refund process. This was difficult but eventually i got a human who gave me a case no. and a promise!! 11 months late after many emails promising that my case has been 'validated' or 'upgraded'. I am still waiting for my money back. The case no. has changed (upgraded) but was then closed with no refund, no explanation. The chat bot is a complete waste of electrons - just goes around in circles (designed like this of course).

Air Asia cancelled my flight (this seems to be more and more common with them), but did not refund the money to my credit card account. They have stopped providing any general call center services - there are no phone numbers. Instead, there is only a bot controlled chat function (online or app) that limits your ability to request anything except what they want you to request. No access to a real person. After a couple of glitches involving the bot, it finally found my records and transferred the refund to my member "credit account." Supposedly, within a limited amount of time, the credit can be used to buy another ticket from Air Asia. But there seems to be strings attached. I'll never use Air Asia again unless there is no other option.

I now see all the same reviews like mine. AirAsia is a thief. I asked for a refund following the pandemic which they accepted in March 2020. They have been going round and round saying it's in progress for months. Then closed my case with no refund. Thieves, liars, no compassion. Never ever again I will buy a ticket with them and you shouldn't either.

My wife and my son (1.5 years) took a domestic flight today from manila to bohol in the Philippines. Obviously she had luggage of 30kg prebooked, my son was not allowed to have his own luggage for checkin. My wife had to pay his luggage of 30 kg PER kg, which means 10800 PHP=200 USD.  You just lost a client of the past 6 years.

I booked a flight last june. they cancelled (covid). Submitted a request for a full refund, waited 8 months only for them to cancel my case! No email, no communication on why they refused my refund! I cant get my money back. cant even get credit with them as compensation. They have made it impossible to contact a real person, only the stupid AVA chat bot. I paid for a service, never got the service, never got my money back.

Air Asia cancelled my flights 3 times and refused to refund me after 6 months and offer me credits. By refusing to refund customers for cancelled flights is as good as cheating customers of their money.

Air Asia are an awful company with zero customer service. If only I’d looked at the reviews before booking. They make promises to refund cancelled flights but these refunds never arrive. It’s impossible to speak to anyone and the automated chat is worse than useless and just takes you round in circles. I finally got a response on twitter and a promise of a refund. This was then turned into a “credit account” and now nobody will respond. A credit account is useless as I wouldn’t go anywhere near Air Asia in the future. They’ve actually profited from covid as they’ve neither provided a flight or refund, which is disgraceful behaviour.

My flight was cancelled by Air Asia due to restrictions caused by Covid in February 2020. I have been waiting since that time (eight months and counting) for a refund, as is Air Asia's legal obligation. AA have renegued multiple times in promises to repay me in that time. Now, despite not receiving a cent in refund, my case according to Air Asia, is now 'closed'. This is to inform Air Asia, that while the amount of money I have lost is not life changing, I think I speak for thousands of other former passengers cheated out of funds by you when I say that I will do everything in my power to never fly AA again. You may be desperate to stay in business but you have no right to effectively steal funds from passengers. I sincerely hope Air Asia goes bankrupt.

Absolutely the worst airline to deal with! Our flights were cancelled in March due to COVID-19. I requested a refund, and on 18/03/2020 was told my refund was processed and my money would be returned within 10-15 calendar days. 8 months later and I haven’t received a penny! I was then emailed in May to say I could have a credit account! Replied saying are you having a laugh! No thank you! Since then I have messaged every other day via their Twitter account as this is the only way I can contact them. No phone number, no email address an infuriating automated system that tells you nothing and solves nothing. Each time I am told that my refund is in the final stage and will be back in my account shortly and nothing appears! I am a nurse in the UK and was due to go and see my dad who lives in Manila with my family. It’s bad enough that our 3 week holiday was cancelled, this is just rubbing salt in the wound! £500 of my hard earned money that they were quick enough to take is still not back with me! I couldn’t be angrier. Their customer service is seriously sub standard and I would not recommend anyone to use this company! Modern day robbery at its finest. Would be giving 0/10 if allowed, but has to begrudgingly be a 1/10! Seriously, avoid this company like the plague.

aCovid happened and the world went into meltdown, flight cancelled and I wanted a refund -  what an awful awful process. Never known anything like it. Cant speak to anyone, and the virtual assistant is just infuriating (possibly the worst one I have ever used) sends you round in circles, no option for live chat and doesnt seem to learn. Obviously its all done to put you off claiming a refund. As for live chat, well you will wait literally hours for a person to come back to you, if at all. Genuinely the worst customer service I have ever received.

My flight was canceled because of COVID. Because them canceling they have to offer the refund option. They try in so many ways to give a credit and they customer support is non-existent, they only have robot AVA that is instructed not let you talk to a real person. In the end I got a case number for a refund that would take 12+ weeks to process. Two weeks ago they tried again and sent an email with the cryptic message "If we don't fail to hear from you within 14 days we will process a credit" (whatever that "if we don't fail" means). I replied by email and of course no confirmation. I will never ever use Air Asia again.

On 1 Aug 2020, I purchased a flight ticket from AirAsia. On 15 Aug 2020, AirAsia cancelled my flight and refuses to refund. They only offered credits. Everyone knows the credit is worthless. In AirAsia's audit report, EY has highlighted there is material uncertainty over AirAsia's going concern status (i.e. AirAsia might become bankrupt within the next year). If AirAsia goes bust, all credits are almost certain to be worthless! To AirAsia: You cannot open a flight, take our money, then cancel the flight to keep the money! This is unethical! As much as you need cash, you cannot do this!!! You've might have gotten my money now, but I will never fly AirAsia again, even after this pandemic!

You will not get a refund at all. Bought a flight tickets with AirAsia in Jan-2020, but it got cancelled due to Covid-19. Requested for a refund back to credit card but failed, they will give excuses just not giving back the refund, instead they offered with credit account which I will never use it again.

route: Chiang Mai to Kolkata via Bangkok
review: Don't accept the credit. Cancelled my flight and offered a refund (pre-covid). Since then they have tried to convince me to accept a credit instead and they have stalled with giving me my refund. They were only 20$ cheaper for this trip compared to another company that I was supposed to fly another leg of my trip with. And that company has already given me my money back months ago because Airasia cancelled this part of the trip. If you accept the credit you change the terms of your initial deal and you are now subject to their new terms. By not accepting the credit they are still obligated to the conditions of your initial contract. You can demand your money back through the bank that handled the transaction. You can demand the money back through the card company if you paid via Visa, Mastercard etc.

route: Amritsar to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Amritsar to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur booked for April 2020. I’m still waiting for my ticket canceled money they didn’t refund ticket money ticket was canceled from AirAsia because Covid-19.

Kota Kinabalu to Kuala Lumpur. Do not use this company. My flight was cancelled for Covid 19 in April, and they will not refund for flights they cancelled and the insurance they provide does not cover this either.

My flight has been canceled and when I have contacted customer Service they told me that I must buy another tickets (for 3 people) and I'll get the refund. So I have purchased the new tickets. Then Lockdown and my airport has been closed. I wanted to contact customer Service, but There was no chance to reach someone There. As instructed on their website, I used AVA thing to cancel Our flight, then I had to buy new tickets again. Of course before cancelation I've been informed that I'll get a refund. Till today (since march) I didn't get a penny.

route: Sydney to Taipei via Kuala Lumpur
review: I have booked them for Trip to Taiwan and unfortunately impacted by Covid-19. So i requested for a refund. In the beginning, it is voluntary, and then it is a credit account request and finally, it is refund back to original payment. So I have chosen credit account while the refund back to original payment is not available at this time. Soon when refund back to original becomes available, i raised refund case again. Then i have contacted them many times to advised them i only need the last case progress, and they said: "don't worry, we will process the latest case under your account." Then they choose to refund back to the account, not original payment method, and now refused to refund back to the original payment method.

route: Singapore to Sabah via Kuala Lumpur
review: Singapore to Sabah via Kuala Lumpur. I canceled my trips with AirAsia, and got fully refund into the credit account. The procedure took me around a month to be credit into my AirAsia member account. Although those credits have to be spent within a year, but I am glad and very satisfied with the services.

Been waiting for something, anything from Airasia since they canceled my flight. What a joke around and around with absolutely no result no return contact, nothing. BIG Loyalty Program member for years? Nothing more than a farce. I've been a long time user of this airline, 24 flights alone in the past couple of years but never again.

Horrible service from AirAsia. For the past 1 month, i've been trying to get a refund for my flight because of the pandemic. I've tried to reach out to them through their website, but i just keep getting redirected to their online chat bot AVA. Problem is AVA doesn't resolve anything, and it's buggy. I resorted to contacting them on Twitter, but that was not helpful at all as well. They would give you a reply, and proceed to not reply you for another week. It's always being picked up by another customer service agent, so they always ask the same few starting questions. Nothing gets resolved or moved on at all.

Kota Kinabalu to Kuala Lumpur booked for 29th April. It's the pandemic right now so I wanted to reach out and ask if I could change my flight date then through their customer service line they said to reach them through twitter or Facebook so fine. Used twitter instead because Facebook was irresponsive last time used. Dropped a text no response now great it passed 48 hours in changing went there to change it counter was close it's before 5pm but I'd understand the pandemic. No resources online to reach out to anyone to change and it seems like this ticket is going to burn cause it doesn't give much of an option. Not going to use this airline again

Received a notification that my flight to KL is cancelled. However I have another domestic flight from KL to Kota Baru so I wanted that they cancel the other flight as well (cause if I cancel myself refund would be different) and they refund me instead of a credit note. Have called India call center - useless - there is no number for flights outside Asia, chat bot is a machine that doesn't understand any of the specificities of my case of course, customer service just doesn't exist, facebook account has no-one on the other end either, no customer service person on linked. I am appalled and shall never use that airline again if they don't refund me.

Singapore to Bali. The customer service and credit shell application process for Air Asia is terrible. I had to transfer two other airline bookings into a credit shell due to the CV19 situation and both took under two minutes to complete with confirmation coming a few days later. I have tried countless times to contact AirAsia and with no success. Even the telephone line to India is an automated response and redirects you back to their AVA bot chat which is beyond useless. The credit shell process is both difficult and unclear. Extremely disappointing.

route: Penang to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: Worst customer service and Chat Bot.  I'm talking about AVA. first of all, AVA gives a set of topics to choose from i.e CoVid 19 Flight Changes, booking changes, etc. If you follow everything right, hypothetically you could reach their actual customer support which I could never reach even after waiting sometimes for 2 hours online. I've been doing this for the past week. Looks like there are many in the same boat here. My only concern is if i cant get my refund processed before my flight date which is on the 23rd April. What happens if I can't reach them?  Wouldn't it be better if we could reach them at a call center instead of chatting with AVA? This is very frustrating!

Flight was cancelled a week before the departure, due to Covid19 travel ban. Refund was not generated automatically but I have to submit “manually” but unable to due to their system error. Keep appearing as “cancelled”. Despite many trial time, we are not able to reach to speak to an agent,  wasting much of my time.

Do not fly with them. They cancelled my flight and I've spent days trying to get a refund or credit. They do anything not to talk to you and put you through hoops of never getting in contact with them. Only way is to drive out to the airport 3 times and still they just send an email shutting the case with no explanation. They cancelled the flight to keep tourists trapped in Bali during Covid and still won't give a refund.

Tokyo Narita to Bangkok booked for 6th March. I put in a request for a full refund as AirAsia cancelled my flight. They advised me to wait 30 days for the refund. It is now over 30 days and still no refund.

route: Melbourne to Vientiane via Kuala Lumpur
review: Melbourne to Vientiane via Kuala Lumpur. I went in circles with the Ava online chat to attempt refunds for 4 flights I had booked over March/ April. My flight was cancelled the day before but luckily I had already decided to change the flight. I had an option for a full refund for this flights and after attempting several times through Ava, I was finally able to make a case. I made 5 cases before I received a notification that it's in progress. My other flights cancelled by Air Asia in April however, do not have a refund option. Only credit or moving the date which I do not want. If the flight has been cancelled, I expect a full refund. At this time, I can't even use Ava as the wait time is over 1 hr to be transferred to an agent. The website, Ava and phone numbers that lead nowhere have taken me in circles for weeks and I'm furious that there is no accountability to customers.

route: Jakarta to Krabi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Jakarta to Krabi via Kuala Lumpur. AirAsia informed suspension of most of their flight operations on 26 March 2020 due to COVID19 situation. Since then I am trying to contact them via their AVA online chat but never can get through to an agent to actually file for refund as per their system. Also tried to call several ticket offices in Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand and never got through. The flight status is also unavailable even bookings are still confirmed. I do understand that the customer service is overwhelmed, but for such a company it should not be an issue to establish an efficient request process system. I really tried everything to contact them and I have to assume that this company is staling on requests in order to avoid the many refund requests. I am highly disappointed by what was once the best low-cost airline in Asia and will never consider them anymore in the future.

route: Kuala Lumpur to Bandar Seri Begawan
review: I was not emailed or contacted regarding the cancellation of the flight. This outbreak has made many travel restrictions and bans to which I was not aware of. I had a feeling my flight was going to be cancelled long ago but it is difficult to contact AirAsia, they have a bot called 'AVA' which isn't a real person who would understand complex questions.  And if you think you can refund the amount you paid for a flight, you won't be pleased when you u read this.  They have refund in the form of "points" and "membership" benefits. I complained that I was not notified and said "but you should already".

Bangkok to Surat Thani. Booked a flight for my girlfriend to meet me in Bangkok, my flight was cancelled so I’ve asked Air Asia to credit my BIG Member account I received a case No, I’ve been non stop on there chat system which is a waste of time, telephone No’s do not connect. The airline customer support is a total disgrace considering the coronavirus situation, they take your money for your ticket but you try and contact them is a disaster, they give no thought for anyone. I have used them before many times, but now see how they treat customers, no chance of getting credit back, very sad company.

Bangkok to Lombok. I purchased 2 tickets with Airasia, during December to use during the month of March. Of course, during this outbreak, the flights have been cancelled. I have tried to understand that Airasia must have busy times, that everything is chaos. Said all that, its embarrassing how customer support and the answers you receive from the airline. Not Malaysia Airlines, not Jetstar, none of the competitors of AirAsia, have just played dumb and get away with the cancellation. Malaysia Airlines in 5 minutes just changed the dates of my flights, the same with the other airlines. Under the same circumstances, AirAsia has just closed my claims (they recommend to just move flight or ask for credit). All my requests have been closed and told that "I am not eligible for the credit). Tried Ava: yep. Terrible. System thors constant errors. Where you able finally to lodge a case? Yep. Suddenly all cases closed. Tried calling the call center: Yep. 1 hour on the phone to India. And they only discuss local flights. Still waiting for an answer. Worst customer service And from my side, never again!

route: Beijing to Siem Reap via Kuala Lumpur
review: Beijing to Siem Reap via Kuala Lumpur. I cancelled my flight on Jan 30 due to covid-19, a case was created by Air Asia on Jan 30 to give me full refund. From AVA, it takes up to 30 working days to process a refund. Today is March 27, 41 working days have passed, no refund was received yet. I contacted Air Asia many times through twitter but no response and no refund.

I want to credit my flight or at least 'move flight' because of Covid 19 & I have followed each step carefully and correctly. I have spent hours on this only to discover I am charged the full amount. I was promised by email not to be charged any more as I purchased the ticket Jan 2020. It is completely opposite to what the email says.

Penang to Singapore. Very impressed with Air Asia staff. Due to the Covid19 our 13-year-old son had to fly alone on an emergency flight as his boarding school was being closed with no notice. The staff helped him check-in, put him in 1C (yes, I'm jealous) and escorted him through arrivals and immigration where he had to undergo a medical check and be issued with a stay at home notice. I am so thankful that AirAsia staff looked after him. Well done!

Chiang Mai to Phuket. We scheduled flights well before the coronavirus pandemic. When trying to move flights to a different time due to international travel advisories, restrictions, and fear for our health, AirAsia was impossible to get hold of. When we did finally get through via multiple complaints filed, they said we'd still have to pay the change fee or not get refunded. After attempting to contact them numerous other times via every channel possible (AVA, complaints, response to email, attempted to find a phone number with no luck) before our flight was scheduled to depart and we simply never heard back from them. I decided to try them based on price, but it's certainly not worth the lower price.

Hanoi to Kuala Lumpur. I was told my bag was slightly too heavy to carry on so I had to repack it twice, and after some miscommunication paid 800.000 VND to check it (was told I could pay cash&card but I couldn’t). The airplane had the tightest seats I have seen. There was no free water served, but they offered goods for purchase. The flight wasn’t full and so I moved up a few rows but was told I couldn’t sit there. It was a different class, but the seats were the same.

Bali to Singapore. AirAsia should do more for those who are afraid to fly during the COVID-19 period even if the said country is not under 'high alert' (for example Indonesia, which is greatly underestimated due to a lack of monitoring system in place). At least issue some sort of voucher for future use. I will not fly with AirAsia anymore. There is no way to talk or contact a physical live person.

route: Male to Perth via Kuala Lumpur
review: Male to Perth via Kuala Lumpur. The airline rescheduled our ticket and sent an email with the new itinerary. Upon trying to speak to a customer representative we get this virtual assistant to chat with which keeps on sending automated response based on what we were typing. Then we are send on another page but the page keeps on loading. The airline cancelled our original flight and gave us a transit of 20 hours from KL to Perth. we asked to be given a hotel to freshen us up but they kept on sending us from here to there without any concrete actual help. We emailed them but no answer about the accommodation.

My sister and I had booked an AirAsia flight from Phuket to Bangalore which had a 11-hour layover in Bangkok so that we could visit Bangkok for a few hours. In spite of explaining our intent, we were sent by AirAsia staff in Phuket to immigration for exit, which ended up with us reaching Bangkok and being told to stay in the airport for 11 hours! A big shout out to the AirAsia staff in Bangkok who understood what happened and she made us meet the immigration staff in Bangkok, got the exit stamp on our passports reversed and resulted in letting us experience Wat Pho! We had to go through the immigration exit process again which was as per the immigration rules.

Kuala Lumpur to Makassar. The manual check-in system in down when our visit. So, we use the Air Asia self-check-in System, so no problem with check-in. The immigration queue is terrible, extremely long and took a lot of time, I wait around 45 minutes for immigration. The in-flight meal is great, delicious. The flight attendant is nice.

Kuala Lumpur to Cebu. You need to go to the airport 3 hours before because the check-in staff were slower than usual. They didn't hold to boarding and flight time even while on time. The planes are quite uncomfortable but I don't mind that. The airline has no online customer service other than their AVA chat program. They have nothing to answer even just simple general questions.
Bangkok to Siem Riep. They charged us for our backpacks that were overweight by a few pounds. Their limit is 7 kilos and charged us $180 for a few pounds. We will never use them again.

I had booked ticket from Chennai to Kuala Lumpur return. While going they allowed to check in baggage of 20 kg, on my return they said that I had not opted for check in baggage and you have to pay 100 Mal $ to checkin the baggage.  Finally I had to pay extra for check in my luggage to return back India.

Kuching to Kuala Lumpur. I love the flights themselves. Very well priced, punctual and the in flight crew are great. I have given a 1/10 rating for AirAsia's lines of communication pre and post-flight. Facebook and twitter are ghost towns. There is no longer anyone you can get on the phone. You can't find links to make email enquiries. Their virtual assistant AVA isn't much smarter than a house brick. If AVA can't help you she directs you to the 'ghost towns'. If nothing goes wrong you will experience a well priced, punctual and reasonably comfortable flight but if you need to contact anyone to sort out any kind of problem then just forget it.

route: Gold Coast to Phuket via Kuala Lumpur
review: I was due to fly Gold Coast to Phuket via Kuala Lumpur on 12th March but received an SMS and email stating the flight had been cancelled. To get through to a human is a long drawn out affair repeating the same question to a  robot and then the same again when the before they connect you to the live chat and then again once they actually come on line after 45 mins or so.. They cancelled the second leg to Phuket and there are now no longer same day connections and you have a 16 hour stopover in KL instead. I booked the flight 6 months ago for a great price, now 3 weeks out they cancel without the decency to offer to put you up in a hotel in KL.  The only offer I get is of a refund or credit and I now have no alternative than to fly from the Gold coast to Sydney and then book a new flight at a total cost of $800 due to the departure date being so near. I have been cut off from the live chat 3 times and the managers are just rude. I an airline mess up they should be held accountable and offer some sort of compensation.

Phuket to Phnom Penh. Customer service is a disaster. My flight in March was cancelled which was a direct flight and I was offered a flight with stopover of 8 hrs. All attempts to get a customer service involved failed. The AVA Roboter thing is just a waste of time.

Jakarta to Bali. The original flight I booked was changed, and the new flight allocated to me was no good because I would have missed my international flight. So I contacted AirAsia via the online chat option, and my flight was changed to my preference easily and quickly. Try doing that with Qantas. Many hours later! I arrived for my flight, it was on time, and comfortable. First time I've flown AirAsia, I've heard that they don't have the best name, but I couldn't fault them. From all the staff I met, to the online chat, to the flight, and arriving on time. Thank you AirAsia.

Puerto Pricesa to Manila. Check-in and delivery of the case was quick and effective. Departure and arrival were on time. The aircraft made a well-maintained impression. The seat spacing was good, the on-board staff could be a little friendlier and the food was good against payment. Overall a good experience.

Shanghai to Manila. The check-in was effective and quick. The aircraft in good and clean condition. The seat distance at an emergency exit is very large. The on-board catering and drink against payment were average. Overall a good price performance ratio.

Chiang Mai to Surathani. The customer assistants are mostly rude to me. They try to charge you extra cost and need to demonstrate by your documentation that you booked the extra baggage etc. Prices are good if you get the deal but if you need extra services cit an get more expensive than a regular airways company (not lowcost).

I sympathize with anyone who has negative experiences with airlines, and cannot speak for other flights, but we had a very positive experience with our AirAsia flight from Krabi to Singapore on February 2. Very smooth check-in, no problems with baggage, super clear announcements. Yes this is a budget airlines, so one should not expect, nor will they get, fancy (or any) food, or spacious seats. But AirAsia got us to our location safe and sound, and what's more on time, and that is all that matters to me.

Lombok to Jakarta. I had charges on my credit card for a second unidentified charge that I did not have an invoice for. There was no live customer service at all I could speak to and to investigate this charge and or provide me an invoice. India customer service refused to assist me. Had to dispute the charge with the credit card company since I do not have any details or invoice for these charges. They do not provide any customer service only an automated computer bot that is useless.

Bangkok to Phnom Penh. We arrived early in Don Muaeng airport, Bangkok, for an evening flight to Phnom Penh. We had checked in online, at baggage drop no lines. Through immigration and security also went fast, we talk about less than 5 minutes, very good ! Suvarnabhumi airport should go here and learn. They started boarding 30 minutes before schedule. We had bus out to the gate, and 10 minutes before schedule, we arrived at the plane. The plane was not full this evening, so it started to move, only 3 minutes late. Its pretty narrow onboard, but I did not have my knees crushed in the seat in front of me. We landed ahead of schedule. We are satisfied with Air Asia, everything went smoothly.

Bali to Singapore. Inept ground staff at Bali airport, refusing to allow cabin baggage,  no formal size measure applied. The cabin crew harassing us for change of seats as we were given some premium seat while checking in.

Manila to Cebu with AirAsia. Worst airline and customer service that I have ever experienced. Yes, they are low cost but they don’t care about the people that book their flights. They don’t provide any support if you need to modify your flights and only give AVA as a form of “support.” She’s a bot and when she can’t help, she doesn’t provide any helpful contact information to get a hold of someone who can help. Please boycott this airline. They don’t care about anything but the money.

Kuala Lumpur to Yogyakarta. Something very unusual happened, I was given a red seat for free. Probably the plane was full and there were no normal seats available. Although it didn't make any difference, because this seat didn't have any legroom (same as regular seats). Not very friendly flight attendants, tiny seats, not so low cost.

Chiang mai to Kuala Lumpur. Although flights are well managed when on the plane, the check in process is the worst of any airlines I've ever seen. Wait 1 hour to move a few meters, and eventually 30 minutes before each flight they fast forward people through check in since many people are late. Literally they checked in 20 people in 45 minutes, about 10 minutes for each group and I feel this is generous, this makes no sense at all. Also, check in machines were pretty useless since everyone had to check in anyway, which is weird. Perhaps it's the AirAsia Chiang Mai that's so slow .. they need to get their stuff together, horrible experience.

Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. Refused to print the ticket for 2nd leg of trip at initial gate counter because tickets were bought at separate times. Flight was late but had plenty of time for transfer counter to print said booking closed 5mins ago. Won't do anything. Had to buy another ticket. It took about 7 mins to get to gate from transfer I had 50 minutes. All could have been avoided if they had printed ticket.
