Bangkok to Siem Reap. After almost 10 yrs of flying around Asia with several different airlines I must say that AirAsia tops them all. Never  had a problem flying with them, Ground Staff was friendly, service minded and with a smile. Even when I made a mistake with a ticket hey sorted the problem with no hassle.
Singapore to Kuala Lumpur, no comments. The flight was relatively smooth. No glitches. Services was good. Cabin staff crew were polite and overall had a smooth relaxing trip with AirAsia .

route: Manila to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur
review: Manila to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur. We did not check-in 2 hours before our flight, our flight was supposed to be 1:05AM and we’re at the check-in desk at 12:20AM. The lady in the check-in desk told us that our ticket was forfeited because they have cut-off time.
Denpasar to Perth. Really impressed. Good service on a clean plane. Was quite expensive so doing Jetstar on return. Would use again. Only negative was boarding via buses rather than a gate.

Lombok to Perth. We paid over $100 to add our luggage to the plane, and when we landed, we realised they had not loaded 90% of the passengers luggage on the plane. I had many items in my luggage that I require for work, and now I have to wait and hope it arrives. I was not assigned in the seating I had chosen. I  chose an isle seat as I’m a nervous flyer and they put me, in between 2 other passengers. They don’t take card on the plane? So if you want a meal or a drink and don’t have any cash, too bad.

Kuala Lumpur to Sihanoukville. I entered check in a little late. The staff took my main baggage and sent it to the plane, but there was a problem with my hand luggage and they asked me to pay 50 dollars for 3 kg. Immediately after paying the extra $ 50, the doors were closed and they said they couldn't take me to the plane, and they didn't pay my $50 behind by 5 minutes. We also heard a lot of scolding.

Osaka to Honolulu. Shameless price gouging with combined 7kg limit for 2 pieces of carry-on. Flaky website so that you can't pay for checked-in luggage online and forced to pay double the price at the airport. Terrible customer service: staff openly mocking you suggesting to put on all the clothes from your luggage to make 7kg limit. No empathy, no compromises, no apologies, instead rude, dismissive attitude. Staff members covering their ID tags and refusing to call their names so I could file a complaint to upper management. Just out of spite check-in counter staff put me on SSS (selective security screening). The last manager I spoke to had a strategy of listening to my complaints with a poker face, not responding until the gate is about to close, and I am forced to shut up and board.

Kuala Lumpur to Bali. Our 1030 departure had a 7h delay. It took over an hour for staff to come to the gate to explain that the flight was delayed and to deal with customers. There were 3 of us that wanted to remove our baggage, be refunded and hop over to the other terminal to take a 1230 MAS flight to Bali instead but AirAsia took so long to get staff we realised we would never make it. Staff agreed to move us to a 1615 Air Asia flight to Bali however we had to go back outside to the chaos of baggage drop and immigration. After standing fighting for another hour, they eventually agreed to move our luggage over to the new flight without us having to do it all ourselves. They refused us access to the pod hotel in the departure lounge or their Lounge. They provided one bottle of water for 7h and offered a KFC in that time. Staff pushed us around the houses to talk to operations managers to try and obtain lounge access to relax.

Hanoi to Kuala Lumpur. We had 4 flights booked and paid together but could not sit together unless we paid additional fees at check in to get seats changed. This is a revenue raising exercise. In addition to that the staff were very rude to me and appear to go out of their way to be unhelpful. In flight service is not existent, flights with not even a free drink without incurring additional costs. Aircraft very cramped spaces, not comfortable.

Kuala Lumpur to Cochin. I had a very awkward experience with AirAsia. My booking was confirmed directly by the service agent of AirAsia. When I reached to counter I was told that the flight was overbooked. I then had to keep on begging the lady at the counter for an hour to let me fly. When I asked the executive at the counter to call the manager, she said now you can travel and I could fly, I just had to simply waste my 1 hour time at the counter with no reason.
Utapao to Kuala Lumpur. I travelled from my favorite airport from Utapao. I love flying from this airport as it is so small. I used the new terminal for the first time. I will fly them again.
Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Not recommended if going on a business trip! Long delays, irresponsible staff, improper handling of baggage. Will never fly this airline again.

Chiang Mai to Phuket. Worst airline. They charged my family of Four 5,000 bht ($227 CAD = $56 CAD/person) upon arrival to check our bags. They go by weight. Apparently you can pay the fee online which is 400 bht but they don’t advertise it much. They also offer the lower price if you’re 4 hours early (who would come that early). When we complained they said that’s how it is and weren’t accommodating. Also no flight entertainment or food service on our flight. Would highly recommend a different airline.

Kuala Lumpur to Shenzhen. I came for an early flight to China at 610am, made sure there won't be any screw ups. Boarding gate was P1 on the boarding pass, and I waited for over an hour, and I realized things wasn't right when I do not see any crowd at the gate. Went to check on the screen and it shows the boarding gate is Q7, and it has closed.  Explained my situation to the staff, looked at me and said there's 3 other passengers with the same situation but they all boarded the flight. Other staff told me to work things out at the service counter. Went to the service centre and things went back and forth where it felt like they are trying to look for any fault in the customer. They gave me a replacement flight, which is at 420pm, and two RM20 meal voucher. The summary is that the replacement tickets are a courtesy/favour and I should appreciate it.

Kuala Lumpur to Hanoi. One of the first flights of the day, we departed on time. I managed to get a more comfortable window seat and also bought a meal which was delicious. I also used the 10 GB free wifi allowance.

Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur with AirAsia. Mobile check in allowed me to avoid queuing in Jakarta. The plane left on time. It was pretty full and my middle seat felt quite uncomfortable. Other than that, the usual AirAsia flight with business like crew and a good selection of food for purchase.

Denpasar to Kuala Lumpur. The check-In was well organized and the staff friendly. The departure / arrival was on time and the aircraft made an average maintained impression. The seat spacing was felt a bit lower than other airlines. Food and drinks were, for a low-cost airline, only for a fee. Overall, a good but not special experience.

Bangkok to Medan. Significant delay and no real apology. Flew QZ155. It only started to board at the time it should have been leaving, with no obvious reason (eg the incoming aircraft had been on time). Then crew running around and finding a passenger was missing. But then it took a further 30 minutes to find and offload the luggage from that passenger. So finally a delay of almost an hour. Not really acceptable on a 2-hour flight.

Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. Even after adding in seat selection and 20kg of baggage, the price was still affordable and cheap considering that I only booked a month before the flight. There were problems with the self check-in as I had checked in online with AirAsia, luckily this was sorted out very quickly. Immigration at Changi Airport was very fast. The plane left on the dot at 7:35am and the gate my plane was at was the closest to the runway, so we were in the air very quickly. The seat pitch was just about okay for my height, and it was comfortable for a short flight. The plane was one of the older ones in AirAsia's fleet, not fitted with the sharklets seen on the newer A320s, and the cabin did show signs of ageingty. As it was a 40min flight and a budget airline, there was not much the cabin crew had to do but they were warm and friendly. One interesting perk about this flight was the ability to stream the inflight entertainment into my own device without needing to download a seperate app; all I had to do was to connect to the inflight WiFi which was enabled even on this short hop and I found it very unique, setting aside AirAsia from other budget carriers, and the selection was quite generous too, with some movies, documentaries and even games. The flight landed in Kuala Lumpur early and we had a short taxi into KLIA2, very quickly we were disembarking. Overall, given AirAsia's punctuality and cost, I would definitely pick AirAsia again if I'm travelling to Malaysia or want to travel on a budget.

Bengaluru to Bali via Malaysia. Worst international flight I have ever travelled. No meals even after paying thousands of bucks for the flight. Flight seats are horrible. I would not prefer travelling in AirAsia.

route: Siem Reap to Krabi via Kuala Lumpur
review: We had to rebook new tickets halfway through our trip due to the booking of flights too close together to make baggage transfer despite paying extra baggage charges and being  told our bags would transfer. A  rude customer service employee at  Kuala Lumpur airport told us it was our fault since if they had told us we did not have enough time then we would have done it anyway.

AirAsia have provided an excellent customer experience throughout our journey. The cabin crew were very polite and helpful. I have found that most of the passengers traveling from Hyderabad to Mumbai are local travelers with "Telugu" as the native language. The announcements made in flight are in "English" and "Hindi" languages. It would be very helpful for the passengers if the announcements in flight are made in the native language for the domestic flights. All the elderly passengers would be comfortable with this change. Hope to see this change from my next flight with you!

Delhi to Goa. 2.5 hour flight was delayed by over 2.5 hours and no alternative was given to take another flight instead. If they had just informed appropriately instead of informing about the delay half an hour at a time, we could have taken a different flight.

route: Male to Kota Bharu via Kuala Lumpur
review: I chose Air Aisa because I was travelling with a child and no other directs flight to KL was available. First of all they force people to use PSA which sells expensive tickets by making a bank error on online service if using cards from Maldives. They lost my luggage cover, which was never found after struggles.  On my second sector to Kota Bharu- the que was long and when I reached to drop off the baggage (like a minute) they said I was too late and send me from one counter to another and made me wait and said I can board the plane without the luggage (while travelling with a 2 year old). No other options. Had to buy buy 2 extra tickets for me and the child. 3. When I left the trolley at a side, Air Asia staff told me to take it to the another location, I said I cannot leave my baby behind to put the trolley back, he mumbled rudely.

Singapore to Bali. What a disappointing experience. We went to automatic check in. That machine worked for only one of us. The other one had to go to the counter to check in. Later once we already passed the customs we found out about not sitting next to each other and asked for a correction. This could only be changed if we were willing to pay extra. I asked if they could put us on an earlier flight so that I would be home sooner. This was possible but we had to buy new tickets!

Our flight on November 2 from Lombok to Denpasar became memorable only because of the inflight service. A talented steward serenaded the passengers with a most lovely original song that soothed and enhanced the flight. A most unique personal touch we've never experienced in all our years of international travel.

Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta delayed by 2hrs 50 mins. This is my last flight them. If you have connecting flight this airline will get you in trouble. This airline seems to attract people attracted to low price and fly point to point only, where long wait in the terminal and extensive delays does not matter.

Tagbilaran to Manila. AirAsia is extremely gimmicky and unprofessional! I've flown with very many different airlines for almost 40 years now and I've never ever experienced such unprofessional treatment. They are the only airline that counts your personal/cosmetic bag as part of carry-on baggage weight. However, they only selectively enforce this policy so that makes them utterly unprofessional. I chose to fly with AirAsia for the first time because they had the cheapest cost for my round trip from Manila to Tagbilaran/Panglao, Bohol in the Philippines. On the Manila, to Tagbilaran flight, my carry-on baggage and personal/cosmetic bag were not even checked or weighed at all, but on my flight back the customer service agent chose to enforce their stupid policy and made me pay an extra baggage fee. The worst part about this experience was that I was made to open and repackage my personal/cosmetic bag, carry-on bag, and checked baggage while I was at the check in counter. I was struggling to get the weight just right for them and a security guard noticed me struggling and whispered to me to just take out my laptop from my carry-on baggage because then AirAsia won't count it as carry-on weight if I only take out my laptop and carry it by hand. It's so damn ridiculous! Why didn't the customer service agent just tell me this and save me money, time, embarrassment, and frustration in the first place? Why did she make me go through all that trouble and money and time wasted? I also asked this customer service agent to let me speak with the manager and she just kept telling me "ok" or "they're busy right now." I also noticed that very few other passengers were made to weigh both their carry-on and personal/cosmetic bags as I were. This horrible airline is the worst airline I've ever flown on in my almost 40 years of flying all over the world on so many other different airlines and I will never ever fly with this joke of an "airline" ever again. If you want professional and fair service do not ever fly with Air Asia! They're just a gimmick and a huge joke!

Kuala Lumpur to Guangzhou. The 2 year old A320 neo aircraft has a 186 seat configuration. The seats are quite comfortable, although legroom is quite small. The toilets at rear are very small. The taste of food is good. Our flight departed on time and reached Guangzhou 15 minutes ahead of schedule. Generally, we have no complaints on the flight.

route: Hanoi to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hanoi to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. Worst seats I have experienced in a plane. Be sure to choose a seat that's possible to recline. The distance between the seats are tiny. Me and my girlfriend got seats as far away from each other as possible. Asked if it was possible to get a seat next to each other but no. Even I saw later that there were two seats next to each other.  The Airasia part in KLIA is also bad, really crowded and not many places to eat/shop.

route: Delhi to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: Delhi to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. When I booked this low-cost airline flight online I saw no indication that the ticket did not include checked bags.  I ended up paying $400 additional for checked baggage. Onboard the flight there is no free meal, no free water, no in-flight entertainment screen, renting a blanket is 10MYR.

I flew from Cengkareng Airport in Jakarta to Changi in Singapore. There are too many bad things flying with this airline. I paid about $250 for a two-way ticket Jakarta to Singapore. At the website, I had to pay an additional $30 for check-in baggage. When I checked-in, the female staff were rude. No greetings and pretending to be busy like I was invisible. And them the flight was late. Scheduled to depart at 11.20 am. At 12.30 pm the plane was still on the runway waiting for take off. As a result, the flight was late about an hour arriving in Singapore. I had a meeting at 4 pm on the same day and I was late and it was embarrassing because they thought I was not punctual. When in fact, it was caused by Air Asia. And then, when returning home, the staff in Singapore were rather mute. They just saw us, say nothing and kept working. Hello? Are you human or robot? Can you talk? Wow? They call Air Asia a company? Even a 1 star hotel in Singapore does a better service. I would say improve the service or good luck in the future.

Hyderabad to Mumbai with AirAsia. One of the worst airlines ever seen who doesn't care about customers and who keep delaying flights indefinitely. Never ever travel by this airline as your important schedule is going to be gone, 100% guaranteed. One of the most lowest grade airlines.

Hanoi to Kuala Lumpur. I had a 3 hour-ish flight with this one. The check-in was not really fast even though it's self-service and there are many security checks. The boarding time was delayed for roughly 20 minutes. The food I had on the flight (teriyaki chicken rice and curry puff) was just average. The crew is quite young, they did okay service. Seats can recline,  Legroom is terrible. The best thing you can do on this one is having a sleep. Don't choose this airline if you can afford any other options.

Kuala Lumpur to Kota Kinabalu with AirAsia. Poor airline with excessive seat rows and extremely tiny seats. Flights were delayed on both ways with no compensation. Delays were an hour and felt like the delays were somewhat on purpose for the airline to save money. When boarding gates, no personnel came to check details and everyone just stormed into the gate. This is by far the worst experience I ever had on an airline. Only travel on this airline if you like to arrive late to your destination.
Langkawi to Kuala Lumpur. The flight was delayed one hour due to late arrival of aircraft. A little rough in parts due to the weather. Cabin staff were humorous and that made a big difference.

Kuala Lumpur to Denpasar. It was a flight delayed about one hour. The flight was comfortable and I slept a little. Did not purchase anything as I was not hungry. We arrived in Bali around 1:30am one hour late.

Sibu to Kota Kinabalu. I miss the flight due the aircraft left 13 minutes before scheduled departure time. When approached the ground staff the only explanation they gave me, “is very common” so is my fault that I miss the flight. I had to reschedule all my appointment and pay extra for a new ticket. The worst experience by far.

Bali to Bangkok. Chaos at check in counter in Bali! The counter opened late and passengers were nervous. There were many flights leaving around the same time, passengers from earlier flights tried to skip the queue and go first making other passengers furious. There were no sign indicating which flight should check in first and which flight later, so passengers clustered everywhere in front of check in counters. Very unpleasant experience.

Bangkok to Hat Yai. Lack of standard among ground staff. I pre-purchased 20kg of sport equipment baggage aiming to cover 2 bags of mine. (The combined weight of my 2 bags was 18kg.) A ground staff told me that I could only check in one bag and had to hand carry my other bag. Her reason was that the other bag could not be sport equipment! I've traveled with sport equipment several times with AirAsia, but this was the first time a ground staff refused to check in both bags because such staff believed that my other bag could not be sport equipment! I wonder why other ground staff from my previous flights never had a problem with me..

route: Bali to Seoul via Kuala Lumpur
review: Bali to Seoul via Kuala Lumpur. AirAsia sent us an email the morning of our flight stating that they pushed back our departure. We contacted the customer service chat and tried to resolve the issue. The initial agent said that they would put us on an earlier flight out of our current location, however, they failed to provide us a case number. Additionally, they stated that the flight change would be processed in 2 to 3 hours, which is ridiculous. We had to contact a second customer service agent through their chat service. They then provided us with our case number but reiterated that they could not expedite our flight change any faster than the 2 to 3 hours quoted by the initial agent. When we asked if there was a number we could call the agent stated that they are in the process of closing all of their call centers. They did nothing to ease the stress of having a last-minute flight change that would make us miss a day of work. This was unhelpful and led to the last few hours of our vacation being stressful and having to re-arrange multiple plans. Definitely not good customer service.

Kuching to Kuala Lumpur. I arrived at the Gate 4 at the Kuching International Airport at 9.20 this morning (12 Sept 2019) for the 9.30  Kuching-KL flight, but the push-back for the plane had already taken place. The ground crew gave me an excuse as to why the plane departed 10 minutes earlier than scheduled. Consequently, I had to purchase a later flight (10.50 Kuching-KL flight) at a cost of RM349. If the plane in actuality departs 10 minutes earlier, then the Airline should state inform passengers that the flight was scheduled at 9.20, not 9.30 am.

route: Hanoi to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hanoi to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur. Customer service could not have been more unhelpful. We had credits towards a flight that “due to a bug in their system” they weren’t able to apply to our flight. Which is questionable - why should we pay for their error and incompetence? Every time we tried to rectify the issue we were issued a new agent and new complaint number and had to start from scratch every time. In the end, they said they were working to applying it towards our flight but it could also be used to pay for baggage. Of course the problem was never resolved, so we assumed we could at least check our baggage using our credits. Wrong. Apparently there is no systemic connection between the people at the air Asia counter and the customer service people online. The people at the counter were unhelpful at best. Ultimately, the customer service online system and the physical counter at airasia are somehow not linked. Very advanced system! We were told we had to request online 4 hours in advanced of the flight to use the credits towards our baggage. Of course this was not mentioned by customer service online. The people behind the counter were very rude and condescending and made no attempt to resolve the problem other than to tell us to contact online customer service - the same folks who had not responded to any of our recent inquiries/ noted we could just apply the credits to our baggage for our next flight. I have had the shit beaten out of me by a bunch of meth heads, and I preferred that to dealing with air Asia’s customer service.

Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. Flight was delayed by 6 hours and AirAsia could not accommodate me getting on to another flight. I was travelling for a specific event which I could not miss, so I had to purchase another ticket on another airline at KL airport. AirAsia could not be more unhelpful and told me to go through their AVA chat line to request a refund for my missed flight. I did - only to find out that my case was never recorded. Just tried to process the refund again and ran into technical issues. The ordeal was extremely stressful and expensive, and their customer service is a joke.
Colombo to Kuala Lumpur with AirAsia. It was a nice flight with no problems. Boarding was orderly. Seats were comfortable and I got some rest. A nice budget airline. Will fly them in the future.
Kuala Lumpur to Melbourne. This was an eight hour flight and I had three seats to myself. I was able to get some well earned rest on the flight. Boarding was good. Will fly AirAsia again.

Kuala Lumpur to Nha Trang with AirAsia. Simply the worst airline in the world, many years running. I’ve been unfortunate enough to have to rely on this sorry excuse for an airline for years and not once, not once, have I ever had a good experience. Not a single flight that went smoothly, with no delay or some other nonsense. Awful service, always late, anything to take your money and always unpleasant. The only thing they haven’t charged us for yet is oxygen on board, which at some point it will probably be charged also, 10 cents per breath. If only there were other options for certain destinations. Today’s misfortune: retiming of flight the day before, only to come to airport, go to gate as indicated and find out there (i.e. at the gate) that there would be another delay on top of a change in gates. Still waiting to board, holiday ruined. Avoid this airline if you can. Pay more, get better service somewhere else.

Kuala Lumpur to Nha Trang. Simply the worst airline in the world, many years running. I’ve been unfortunate enough to have to rely on this sorry excuse for an airline for years and not once, not once, have I ever had a good experience. Not a single flight that went smoothly, with no delay or some other nonsense. Awful service, always late, anything to take your money and always unpleasant. The only thing they haven’t charged us for yet is oxygen on board, which at some point it will probably be charged also, 10cents per breath. If only there were other options for certain destinations. Today’s misfortune: retiming of flight the day before, only to come to the airport, go to the gate as indicated and find out there (i.e. at the gate) that there would be another delay on top of a change in gates. Still waiting to board, holiday ruined. Avoid this airline if you can. Pay more, get better service somewhere else.

route: Bandar seri Begawan to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur
review: Bandar seri Begawan to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur. 7kg carry on limit makes no sense. With my camera and commuter stuff that's already nearly 7kg. It doesn't make sense that I can't take more. What's worse is that the company makes airport staff charge people fees to check in bag. I had a total of 14kg with two small bags. The staff made me check in my bag and charged me nearly 90USD "for 0-15kg overweight".  To top it all off, the staff lost my bags' special cover during transit and took no responsibility for it. They said "that's not covered by us" I will not fly AirAsia for these reasons.

This was an evening flight. I was worried the flight might be delayed when taking-off or landing (because DMK and CGK packed with passengers!) However we landed 30mins ahead of schedule! The pilots were able to take off and landed the aircraft smoothly with little turbulence. This time I ordered Chicken Teriyaki (pre-book) and it is good. Rice and chicken not dry, well seasoned.

Actually I'm flying AirAsia Indonesia, the first flight of the day. Ground service is normal, quick check-in and baggage drop although when entering boarding gate (is it normal at CGK, one boarding gate could serve 2 different flights) did not put clear signs indicating which queue lines were for which flight, some passenger queued in the wrong line. Delayed take-off due to runaway congestion and bad visibility (maybe) but we still landed ahead of schedule. Food, I ordered Chicken Kungpao with rice and it was just bad. The rice and chicken were super dry, sauce too watery and taste like soy sauce. Not what you expect of kungpao chicken.

Perth to Denpasar Bali on Low Fare. Had to cancel trip, and Air Asia after 2 months of negotiating gave us a partial credit which had to be used within 3 months. We were Loyal BIG Members. After this lack of compassion we will be looking at other carriers to Asia from Perth.

route: Male to Taipei via Kuala Lumpur
review: Male to Taipei via Kuala Lumpur. I booked a extra meal and a value pack at the same time, so I would get 2 meals for each segment of flight. However, I only got one meal served. I left a feedback to their customer service several times,but I still can't get any proper response so far. They told me they will handle it on 04 July but it's 13 August now I still get nothing. Even their two agents also told me they had refund the some fee, however it became lies. I really doubt they will really refund this fee. What a terrible customer service?

Hanoi to Kuala Lumpur. I booked a hire car through the AirAsia website which upon selecting the car diverts you to cartrawler.com - I received a congratulations for booking email and an updated itinerary with hire car noted. 45 mins prior to departure I received another email starting a hire car cannot be provided, I attempted to book another prior to boarding but was unsuccessful so figured I’d just get one on arrival- this was unachievable at KLIA 2 as no office wanted the hassle an hour prior to closing. After an hour of phoning 24 hour hire car companies I gave up, which meant the Hotel that was booked and paid for in JB was not used and unable to be refunded and the trip planned to Legoland with my 5, 7 and 10 year old sons was now canceled. Shame on you AirAsia and your inefficient car hire partner  - you spoiled the highlight of our school holiday adventure

Kuala Lumpur to Taipei. I purchased two meals for my flight in advance, however, I only got one meal served. I tried to contact their customer service several times and in different ways (facebook and message), but I didn't get any response. Their customer service is terrible. I definitely won't fly with AirAsia next time.

route: Bali to Siem Reap via Kuala Lumpur
review: Bali to Siem Reap via Kuala Lumpur. They charged me around 250 dollars for my baggage of 24.4 kg although it did not let me buy luggage online beforehand.  What kind of airline has such costs and flexible luggage rate based on which check in agent you get?

route: Cebu to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: Cebu to Penang via Kuala Lumpur. We paid an excessive price for 2 checked baggage because we could not do it online. On arrival we found our bag in a sorry state, I no longer had my cover, missing items, open bags. We are given a web page where to make a claim and as luck would not work. Company to avoid. If you do not want to pay more for your luggage than your ticket. FR: Nous avons payé un prix excessif pour 2bagages en soute car nous n'avons pas pu le faire en ligne. A l'arrivée on a retrouvé nos sac dans un piteux état, je n'avais plus ma housse, objets manquants,sacs ouverts. On nous donne alors une page internet où faire une réclamation et comme par hasard cela ne marche pas. Compagnie à éviter. Si vois ne voulez pas payer plus cher les bagages que votre billet d'avion

Male to Kuala Lumpur. This is a red eye flight, so you want to sleep after boarding. however the seat is very crowded. I booked a value pack and purchased another vegetarian meal for my mother. So I should get two meals totally. However I got only one meal served. They have killed their customer telephone number and I got no any reply even I left message on facebook twice and filled up a refund form online.

Kuala Lumpur to Penang. Book 1st flight 5.25am for 2 person because very cheap at less than RM100. Arrived at check in kiosk 4.30am. Counter informed check in close 1 hour before flight. So no choice bought the following flight as the next flight closing in 20 minutes. Whopping 280 per person and for 2 person 560 plus. No choice paid as need to meet appointment. Boarding pass handed only notice hot seat. No wonder so expensive. I was not told whether normal seat available or not. Very costly in the end.

Singapore to Jakarta. My flight to Jakarta was delayed, AirAsia sent me an email saying that i have an option to get a refund. And when I follow the steps as stated in the email to request for refund from their website, there's no refund option. There's no email address either. There's only a livebot, which is useless as it only has standard answers. I wrote a complain and they only say they will send to relevant department to handle. I am now waiting for their follow up.

Phuket to Chiang Mai with AirAsia. Worst service I have ever experienced on an aircraft. I'm 6'4" tall and literally could not sit in my seat without physically bruising my knees as the legroom is that short. I stood for entire flight apart from when seatbelt signs were on and came away with bad bruising to both my knees. Despite there being 11 extra legroom seats available the cabin crew would not let me sit there (even for extra payment that I offered) but instead just smiled at me as I stood. I showed then the damage the seat had done to my knees after take off and they just did not care. I watched them throw a lady out of the extra legroom seat who was trying to breastfeed a baby, this is how uncaring they are. On making a subsequent complaint I received a totally inadequate reply from them. If you are over 5'8" do not use. I am now looking at taking legal action for my injuries and suffering as only way I can see these airlines learning.

Kuala Lumpur to Johor Bahru. I bought the ticket online for 75MYR including checked baggage of 20 kg when I reached the airport they charged me 90.10MYR for 15kg baggage which is the only baggage I have because I didn't check in 4 hours before the flight. The flight got delayed 1 hour. They destroyed my bag.

Krabi to Bangkok. I'm 6' (1.8 meters) tall and my knees were touching the back of the seat. Absolutely no leg room. The only reason we took AirAsia is because we wanted to arrive at Don Meuang Airport. AirAsia prices are almost never as good as they sound. By the time one adds luggage fees, choosing a seat fee, credit card fee and other fees, the prices generally are not much cheaper than other airlines.

Cebu to Manila. Customer Service useless. I had issues in booking, basically I have earned many Big Points along the years plus I had Credit Account Balance to get some discount during bookings. I have tried during different bookings to apply the credit I had with AirAsia but neither the Big Points or the Credit Account ever worked, I applied them but they magically disappeared whenever I click the magic button "pay" and the full amount has always been charged to my bank account. I have complained a couple of times but the only answer those "customer service representative" give is some template answer saying that they are sorry bla bla bla and my points are still there to redeem. This is ridiculous and disappointing, never had such a bad customer service being a Gold member as they call me.

Lombok to Kuala Lumpur. The luggage fees are outrageous. Airport security tell us we can’t take a tripod. The baggage people should be aware of what we can not take with us.  Will never be flying this airline again.

If you're a person with a disability, do not travel with Air Asia from Don Mueang Airport. You will have to climb the stairs to get on the plane. Even if you pay 600 Thai bahts for the wheelchair service, this stops at the departure gate! A family member or friend can do it. I guess they don't want to pay for direct access to their aircraft? Of course the bus does not stop at the edge of the platform, you'll have to get down a high step and then get on the bus, one more step. Then get off the bus, one more step and a nice stair is waiting for you and your disability! In fact, Air Asia has changed its slogan: "Now the disabled can walk" And Don Mueang airport is changing its name, it is now the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes Airport! The place where miracles happen, in this case, it's a paid miracle, a miracle that will never happen.

Wanted to order a coke can called the flight attendant saying excuse me thrice. On the third try the guy showed me his hand to wait.  I'll be skipping this airline due to the attitude of a flight attendant. As a low-cost airline no tv, no free food and the baggage allowance can't go more than 20 kg for which you have to pay too. The least they could do was to provide a good customer service.

Jakarta to Bali. So happy to see AirAsia finally use paper box for their food. I hope they will provide reusable spoon and forks instead of plastic soon. I had Pak Nasser Nasi Lemak, the taste has changed, the chicken tasted more like curry. Taste good, just was not what I was hoping for. Flight attendants was friendly and very helpful.

route: Lombok to Guangzou via Kuala Lumpur
review: Lombok to Guangzou via Kuala Lumpur. Not able to link my luggage through for my total flight, as it is a low cost airline. During the flight the intercom was only quiet for about 10 minutes. A constant voice making it impossible to sleep/relax. If you want food you needed to pay for it, although it wasn't possible with credit card. By far the worst experience I've had with an Asian airline.

route: Hong Kong to Bali via Bangkok
review: Hong Kong to Bali via Bangkok. AirAsia exceeds my expectations the staff are some of the friendliest and helpful staff I’ve ever met on a budget airline! Everything I here negative about the company doesn’t make sense I’ve been travelling now for 6 months around south east Asia and every month I use them at least 1-2 times maybe more! They are an incredible airline!

27th May 2019 Air Asia Flight I5 1582, between Bengaluru to Hyderabad. Impressed with the energy of Inflight Crew. So focussed and guest centric. Smiling and well groomed. Special thanx to Lakshman to offer his meal. Short of cash.

Short 1h20 flight from Kuala Lumpur to Phuket departed and arrived on time. I wouldn't complain much here as the fare was very low ($30 USD) but the seats are not very comfortable (for a short flight I guess it's fine). No entertainment system. The cabin crew was ok. The only drawback for this flight really was the extremely strong AC: bring a down jacket!

Kuala Lumpur to Johor Bahru. Flight was delayed by 45 minutes due to late arrival of aircraft. Overall, flight was routine and crew were professional. Just cross your fingers each time you fly AirAsia that your flight isn't delayed or worse, cancelled (which was what happened to me on another AirAsia flight).

Johor Bahru to Kuala Lumpur. Original flight was cancelled & rescheduled to another timing which meant I reached my destination several hours later close to midnight.  On the plus side, flight left on time & landed early.
I paid 150usd for a ticket from Danang to Kuala Lumpur but ended up paying another 150usd because they said I chose the wrong baggage type. They have the worst customer service!

route: Johor Bahru to Ho Chi Minh
review: Johor Bahru to Ho Chi Minh. Early morning flight from a small regional airport & with no other departing flights at that time, there was no delay & the plane took off on time. An uneventful flight in general with only a slight delay on landing due to the aircraft being put into a hold because of congestion on the ground.

Delhi to Bangalore with AirAsia. Knowing that my bags were overweight, I made sure to send a courier back home before flying back. Turns out I was 3 kgs overweight which even an airline like Air India was willing to let go of (yes, I had a connecting flight prior to my Air Asia reservation). When I checked-in I was told that my bags were overweight and that I needed to pay 1200 rupees. Had a bag less than 2kgs for cabin luggage which should have been taken into consideration but wasn’t. Never mind the 1200 bucks. No big deal. What really angered me was learning that AirAsia charged a single mother travelling with her 9 year old son 300 rupees to get seats next to each other. I mean, I’ve seen inhuman and now I’ve seen AirAsia! What level of exploitation does an airline company need to adhere to make money? I mean, how do people who make money through these days extremely cheap and disgusting ways sleep at night? It’s a 9 year old child. Knowing that parents will do anything to have a sense of security over their children, AirAsia has done the unthinkable! I urge everyone to share this experience and ensure this airline sees the fate it deserves. Absolutely disgusted beyond words!

Kuala Lumpur to Surabaya with AirAsia. Above my expectations! Seats, really comfortable, more so than the KLM flight I was on. Food really tasty, served hot, for a cheap price. Cabin crew, really hospitable, friendly and professional. Ground staff, really on time, and on some instances, more earlier than scheduled. Really recommended.

Very disappointed with AA services! Flight delayed for 3 hours and only announced when all passengers are at the gate! Would highly appreciate a text message indicating flight delay schedule! Flight is 5.25am. I have been here since 4am+, entered immigration only to find out flight is delayed! Ridiculous! Kindly work on ur updates and prior inform your passengers. When you think its not necessary to inform ahead, know that it is!

Kuala Lumpur to Siem Reap. Although I live in Malaysia, I have always opted for full-fare travel. Today was my first flight with AirAsia. And it was not bad at all! Nothing like the "bus station" nightmare I had in my head for so many years. Nice terminal, no bussing around, elegant leather seats, attractive but well-trained crew, decent Asian meals and overall a youthful and energetic vibe. Well done! I deduct one point for the autopilot-y landing whereby we slammed down on the runway pretty hard.

Krabi to Bangkok with AirAsia. Cheap, but not serious. Flight hours were changed immediately after booking from attractive hours to less attractive. The day itself, 2 hours delay, no information. We arrived at our hotel around midnight instead of around the 1800 we initially planned. Cheap but not serious. Fool another idiot next time.
Kota Kinabalu to Kuala Lumpur. Experience above expectation. Comfortable seats, temperature just right. Very friendly and serviceable staff. Tasty and very cheap food. Pleasant flight.

My husband and I flew with AirAsia from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. It was a fantastic experience! The online check was easy and quick, and the baggage check was completely automated and seamless. The onboard staff was very friendly. The flight landed 30 minutes early. Definitely recommended.

I will be flying Air Asia at the end of this month from Perth to Bali. I just found out that I will need to fly straight to Melbourne from Bali for work reasons and won't have time to fly home to Perth. However, Air Asia does not allow for a change of flight destination, meaning I have to book an entirely new flight. I would understand the expectation to pay some kind of a fee for updating the flight destination, but the fact that they don't even offer it as an option is an extreme inconvenience.  Air Asia prevents you from changing flights is to force you into paying for an entirely new flight. I will be doing this as I have no other option, but I will certainly not be flying with Air Asia again.

Kuala Lumpur to Denpasar. Ground handling started seamlessly (as online check-in or by machine is pretty seamless). Boarding was according to expectation. During the flight the cabin crew were extremely friendly. However, the food which I had sausage and pasta was miserable and tasteless.

route: Phuket to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: Phuket to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur. Within less than a month of my scheduled flight, they cancelled my returning flight home to Sydney and rescheduled my flight for 2 days later with a 17:30hr Layover in Kuala Lumpur airport. They would not compensate for any of this the only thing they could do is give me another flight time 2 days earlier than my original booking date and with a 9 hour wait in Kuala Lumpur Airport which means I had to lose out on money with pre booked hotels and ferries and pay for taxis.

route: Singapore to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. Aside from the friendly staff member who was helping with self service bag drops, staff we encountered did not greet us and did not say ‘how can I help you’. My wife and I did not pay additional to get side by side seats for an 8 hour flight. We were told to check with the KL counterparts but we knew that was just an excuse since we won’t have time to speak to anybody after the SIN-KUL leg. We did try but the KL staff told us we could not, without checking the flight status nor touching her keyboard. Cabin crew told us to power down our phone. How do our phones still affect planes in 2019? I was told off by a flight attendant for not powering down as a first warning. Don’t I deserve some slack as a customer?

Singapore to Kuching. It was the best bow cost carrier I have flown with. Earlier, I have had many experiences with airlines like Wizzair, Ryanair or Norwegian, and Airasia is in my opinion the best LCC airline. Friendly staff. I would recommend this airline for short flights.

Kuching to Penang. This is what I love about budget airline. Even though you just pay a little amount of money, sometimes you will be getting a lot more. I even get aircraft miniature in my flight. Plus, all the staff are good looking and very neat.

Hong Kong to Krabi. A couple that travel together and also book together the ticket should be seatead next to each other but at check in they say 'sorry seat are given by computer' so we didn't seat next to each other. Super annoying.

Penang to Kuala Lumpur. Good take off and landing. Cabin crew are all very nice and informative. I always choose this airline. You get what you pay right. Dont be such a fussy when you only just a few pennies.

route: Jakarta to Chennai via Kuala Lumpur
review: CGK-KUL flight was delayed by 45 min due to some runway repairs that we could see from the window. Flight arrived only slightly late. KUL-MAA flight landed 20 min ahead of time. Although I was flying on cheap tickets I could buy exit row aisle seats for both flights. The middle seat remained vacant in both flights probably because no one wants to pay for the pleasure of sitting in the middle seat! In both flights the meal that I had preordered turned out to be pretty tasty. This is what I like about this airline - at the time of booking you can buy the degree of comfort that you want, verify it and then pay for it. Many other airlines would not allow cheap ticket holders to select premium seats. After flying full service airlines on business for decades I have recently switched to AirAsia in part due to the simplicity of the whole process - booking, seat and meal selection, checkin and boarding. The entire meal service is over quickly and they leave you in peace for the rest of the flight. If you need any snack or drink you could walk to the galley and buy it. Also for destinations in the South, SE Asia region they seem to offer the fastest connections.

Bali to Kuala Lumpur. The ticket amount excludes check in baggage which we did not notice while booking.  We had to add 25 kg luggage allowance at 3050₹ extra. There was no free food and not even a free cup of water on this low-cost airline. At Bali airport we reached 2 hr before and were waiting for boarding at designated gate. We just escaped missing our flight as they changed gate before 1 hr.

Kota Bharu to Kota Kinabalu return. Ontime departure & arrival (10-20 minutes earlier arrival for both journey). Reasonable crew, tasty food. Wished that AirAsia will increase the frequency direct flight to 4x week at least. Will fly with them again.

Kuala Lumpur to Surabaya with AirAsia. Swift check-in and orderly boarding followed by a 25 mins late departure due to some passengers not showing up. Plane nearly full, crew all male. Uneventful flight.

Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur with AirAsia. Everything went smoothly. Check in and boarding were painless, and the flight both departed and arrived a bit early. Seats comfortable, meals and drinks available at extra cost as usual.

Manila to Bangkok. The worst part was the check in counter. I had already checked in online but had to check in my pre-paid for luggage. I was there approx 3.5 hours prior to boarding time yet the line up took over 1.5 hours. It was  chaos and only 2 employees checking everyone in. Standing for 1.5 hours is outrageous. Then we boarded the plane 40+ mins late. Once we got on the plane we didn’t leave the tarmac for another 70 minutes. I was unable to make my connecting flight to Chiang Mai. The next flight out was over 7 hours later and air Asia did nothing about it. No hotel, no vouchers, no compensatio.. I had to sleep in the airport, miss a half day of my vacation in Chiang Mai and forfeit my hotel I had pre purchased for in Chiang Mai for the night. Talked to several different air Asia employees in Bangkok airport, none of which were even the least bit helpful or simpathetic. Won’t  fly airasia again.

Bangkok to Krabi. The check-in was fast and the ground staff friendly. For a low-cost airline AirAsia offers a good seating distance, for a small extra charge and food and water as a drink. The plane made a well-kept and well-maintained impression. With this airline you get a good price-performance ratio.

Krabi to Chiang Mai. Months before departure my direct flight was moved from 03:00 pm to 8:30 pm. Due to missing alternatives, I accepted this shift. Otherwise I was satisfied with the airline. Small, good tasting food and water as a drink. The flight was punctual and without any special occurrences.

Flew Kuala Lumpur to Penang with AirAsia. The airline generally offers a great price for my distance I have to travel. However, the cabin crew doesn't really greet us while we board the aircraft which makes us feel a little bit unwelcome. The legroom is also below average but fortunately it is just a very short flight.
Clark to Cebu. Check in counter is not yet open even if already almost an hour before our boarding time. Your staffs here in Clark are not helpful nor accommodating!
Jakarta to Penang. Cheap flight without free baggage and free meals. Worth it and value for money pricing for flight. Must book long long time before flight to get cheap price of the flight.

Perth to Bali. Absolutely shocking customer service. An error occurred when booking my flight, AirAsia was impossible to deal with and refused to change my return date unless I paid $150. I escalated the issue to management and after weeks of following up I have just received a response 2.5 months after first lodged declining to refund. Do not fly with this Airline.

route: Colombo to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: Colombo to Penang via Kuala Lumpur. This is the fifth time that I flew with Air Asia. I've used a few other budget airlines and the services, seats, etc. are standard for any budget airlines - so no complaints. However, I made a purchase for food/drinks on Air Asia, the cabin crew would say that they did not have a small change & promised to give me the change later. On my recent trip from Colombo to Kuala Lumpur, they owed me RM4 and didn't give me the change (I forgot to ask them before I left).

Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. Flight departed & arrived on time. Cabin crew were courteous but distant. Lucky enough to be sitting in an empty row although flight was more than half full. Short flight so nothing much more to add on.

Hong Kong to Chiang Mai. Both out-bound and in-bound flights were on-time. Very little or no turbulence experienced during journeys. This was very good. Check-ins at ground were fast and efficient. Will choose Air Asia again in the future.
Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Plane departed almost an hour late. Other than that, it was the usual AirAsia flight, with added comfort provided by the two seats next to mine being vacant.
Utapao to Kuala Lumpur. On December 16th I travelled from Pattaya to Kuala Lumpur. It was a great flight and very comfortable. I like the Pattaya airport a lot and it is very small and comfortable.

Kuala Lumpur to the Gold Coast. It was a great flight and very comfortable. The flight was not full and I had three seats to myself. I like the Gold Coast airport a lot and it is very small so customs and immigration is very fast.

Bangkok to Denpasar. Uneventful but fairly comfortable fligh . As much as such a flight can be comfortable. It helps when a flight is half full as ours was. Professional crew and as expected they will do anything to promote what ever they sell. If crew on regular airline would make water runs half as often as i have had the drinks sales trolley pass on airasia flight this would make flying more comfortable. On the flight to Denpasar we had what seems to be a new A320 from AirAsia indonesia , return flight on a very tired A320 from AirAsia Thailand. Enjoyed my flights, will surely use them again.

route: Sapporo to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur
review: Sapporo to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur. We had to wait 3 hours after arriving in Kuala Lumpur to board our next available flight. We promptly informed the fly thru staff that we have a checked in baggage on our ticket from Japan to Kuala Lumpur which also needs to be transferred. She said it has been done. However we reached Singapore airport to find our baggage missing! Still following up with authorities for tracking my missing baggage. Never have had such bad service.  They seem cheap but make up all their money on baggage, food, seat selection etc.

Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. AirAsia is known with low-cost fare, but does it mean Low cost = no service? Other than Low-cost fare, Air Asia well known with flight delay, flight rescheduled, poor customer service. It happens regularly that the flight rescheduled on every single flight. Other than the Air Asia low price on promotion is attractive, you'll not surprise if you heard any bad feedback comment about how AA disappointing customer. I'm not the first one and I believe will not be the last one. How AA Customers support system fooling customer around? It must be a platform to train your patience. AA customer support system has 4 ways to contact Air Asia which are Live chat (24/7), call centre, Twitter(24/7) and e-form. I have tried 4 of them: Live chat (24/7): it has been removed - 26 Dec 2018 URL No Longer Exists You have to wait for average 1 hour on live chat queue to say hi to a live chat staff. If you miss the screen when the conversation started, you will kick out from the chatroom by livechat staff, when you check back the screen, it showed "thank you for contacted live chat". You have to wait for another one hour. Live chat staff could simply end your conversation without your notice, so even your question not yet finish,you will be kicked out by the staff again. Call centre: I have called to call centre from Malaysia at RM2 per minute! I wanted to buy/add-on/upgrade my baggage to 25kg (3 days before my flight), but it is no longer available on "modify" at the airasia homepage. The only way is you have to call them (yes waste time + money), otherwise it would me RM45/kg (not sure they increase the price or not) at the check-in counter. waiting time: generally 10 minutes. Twitter (24/7) the so-called "24/7" Twitter service is totally a lie. You can tweet them 24/7, but they will only reply to you immediately, most of the time a few hours or few days. (tweet them for 5 months due to my lost bag case). When the staff is free they will tell you Please wait for the investigation or there's not much they can do, please contact live chat/call/e-form. Live chat, twitter and call centre will push all the responsibility to e-form. Ask you to contact e form. E-form has annoyed and wasted my time the most. It took few days/about 1 month to reply to you, they could just reply sorry that they have done their best and simply closed the case straight after. I've created the same case for 3 times because the staff closed my case without solving my problem, but it is written in the email that my case has been solved, or you didn't reply the email within 7 days. Here comes the tactic: at first you can still contact the AA staffs, but after 3-4 emails, suddenly your reply cannot reach to the AA support team and this will end up case closed because the system shows that you didnt reply to the AA email. When you reply, a no reply email message will tell you that your case has closed, if you need any assistant, please send an e form again! I strongly advise you be aware when you book the AA ticket. The price is really attractive, but please make sure you add on all the bag, meal etc. For the locals, I suggest you check also the price from Malaysia Airlines, Fireflyz and Malindo.

Kuala Lumpur to Hong Kong. Traveling on Air Asia back home on Christmas day. KLIA2 was orderly, not too much that mad rush. Experience with the Premium Flex had been most positive, from check in to arrival. Plane slightly delayed by 30 minutes, which was minor. A surprising light load, with many empty seats, I had all 3 hot seats of row 3 to myself! Therefore, service is quicker and crew very courteous. The chicken rice was delicious. Rest of the flight was uneventful and relaxing. Overall, it's worth to pay that little extra on Air Asia.

I don't often fly with LCC, but given the good flight schedule and attractive price (even at premium flex, both way), I thought to give that a go. I was very pleasantly surprised how smooth things were. From check in to boarding, and through to KL. It was a nice touch that premium flex passengers were entitled a 30kg, a free meal, frontal hot seats, exclusive check in counter and priority luggage. I found out sourced ground staffs in HKG courteous, boarding was orderly, where priority for premium flex passengers were strictly observed. Seat pitch of hot seats were quite ok, just like any regular economy class of any airlines. Cabin crew are energetic and do their job well. Pre-ordered meal was actually quite tasty, mine was a kung-pao chicken with a free water. The duty free item I ordered was delivered to me with a smile. Plane took off and landed on time. KLIA2 is a good terminal with many shops and eateries. I am very satisfied with the whole experience.

Shenzhen to Kota Kinabalu. The FA leaned on the desk without smile at boarding time, after entering the cabin, the FAs didn't assist any woman or elderly person in packing their luggage. They just standing in the aisle. And the FA called me back to my seat, I just want to changed seat with others. I don't think I  can understand the flight attendant instructions in case of an emergency. It was a Red-eye flight, everyone wanted to sleep, but the cabin was always lit. And they spoke so loudly that I could hear laughter with earplugs. I  didn't sleep all night. Although I don't want any service, it's very uncomfortable for me to have a bad rest on a 3 hour flight.

route: Hong Kong to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hong Kong to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur. During 4 legs of my journey, 3 are delayed. As we rush in the airport to go to the next leg, there is no notice about our next flight being delayed thus prompting us to rush even though we should not need to rush. During the delay, there is no compensation. The flight attendants is far from friendly. They seem to be more apt at ordering people around. The seating is cramped. They wanted all electronics to be switched off, not just on airplane mode during take off and landing.

Penang to Bangkok. Late and there is no explanation nor updates. This is the 2nd air asia flight in less than a week and both are delayed. It wasn't like this a few years back. Has it expanded too big and they cannot cope?

Bangalore to Chennai with AirAsia. Pathetic. Very unpunctual. Flight was delayed multiple times. Nearly 6 hrs delay to Chennai. If informed earlier could have caught a bus. Was travelling to meet a relative in critical condition.

Ubon Ratchathani airport to Don Mueang airport in Bangkok. The check in was simple the front desk personally was great and efficient. The security check point at airport was no hassle and simple. Overall my check in was fantastic. Cabin crew was quick and efficient with getting everyone ready and quick with serving all the meals. The only but I have about this flight or airlines was they have so many rules.  Specially seems like lot of rules now that they announced them in 3 languages, Thai, English, Mandarin Chinese.

Bangkok to Jaipur. It becomes painful when you travel with your family, don't travel with small kids as this flight has no space for your legs. Very bad experience, my little kid and wife had a bad time for over four hours in this flight.

Kuala Lumpur to Langkawi. We didnt get our assigned seats as the plane was changed last minute. We were told to sit anywhere until they have everyone seated which meant we had to constantly get up to give up the seats. This was not a good experience. The staff did not apologise. One staff member got very rude to us and shouted at us to be patient. Our flight got delayed by 70 minutes. Will not be flying with them again that's for sure!
Singapore to Kota Kinabalu. Bad counter staff attitude on seating. Boarding pass error and staff was unwilling to assist. System error on web check in. Feedback casually sweeped under.

Cebu to Manila. Nearly 4 hours delayed. First it started with an email that the flight will be delayed due to further servicing then a second email on our way to the airport. However I heard at checked in counter desk a different reason that the assigned aircraft is not available but a new plane will be coming from Manila. And the lady at the counter told me that the plane will be further delayed. Once we passed security, we saw the departure screen was flashing further time of departure. So not sure who to believe anymore but I see lots of lies from AirAsia. This is the second time I actually experience this coming from Cebu so will try other airlines from now on and see who is better at keeping their time and also with communication consistency.

Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. It was my latest worst experience with AirAsia. During check-in, baggage check-in was quite fast. In the new airport, it was comfortable and many lanes that open for passengers to check-in. However, the flight got delayed for an hour and additional another hour. AirAsia which know for its time accuracy got hit really bad with this one.

Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. Before I got into the gate, Airasia wasn't that strict with the baggage 7kg rule check, which is good. Boarding was quite efficient. It was quick and departed according to the time and staff were friendly and helpful.

I think this is the best budget airline in south east Asia. The cabin crew was nice, ground handling is fast, good online check in platform, good customer service. I got no delay when I go to KL but when i back to Jakarta, I got delay around a hour but its ok. The seat is so so, food was good, no inflight entertainment. The ticket from Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur round trip is $30 cheaper than any domestic flight in Indonesia.

Chiang Mai to Macau. AirAsia ripped my suitcase after the flight and everything broken. I connect by AirAsia application and complain about it and I didn’t received any advise after one week. They ignoring me. Please don’t fly with this company.

Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. I have taken several flights from AirAsia. Flight delay is a norm. Had enough of flight delay from this airlines. The turnaround time for plane is just too short. One delay will have an impact on the downstream flight.

Vientiane to Singapore via Bangkok. In Vientiane the check-in counter asked for $200 USD for 2 bags. That is airport/airline robbery. They said it was because we had booked a transfer but we booked from Vientiane to Singapore, they had the stopover in Bangkok included in the booking. I have flown hundreds of time on dozens of different airlines and never been charged for a transfer when the booking is with one airline through their website. Also the price is gross and disrespectful to their customers. My partner and I shuffled items around to fit into one checked bag, however, the whole process was horrible, ridiculous, and not customer friendly. I can't believe we had to pay $100 for one bag for one booking. I am very upset and irritated, I will never book with them again.

Kuala Lumpur to Johor Bahru booked to travel next week. They have the worst customer support, they ignore client when they answer you, they ask you to follow up with them after 5 days. I got problem in my account which was disabled, I contacted their support who answered me after long time them asked me to come back to them after 5 days, although they have all my contact details.

Bangkok to Bali. I recently booked a flight with Air Asia through their website. I was very careful to uncheck as many of the automatically checked add-ons during the check-out process. There was one add-on for travel insurance that I missed. I was subsequently charged for travel insurance when it was not something I intended to purchase. I wrote to them requesting a refund that they promptly informed me that it was not possible as I did not untick the box for travel insurance. Why on earth would they require a customer to untick an add-on rather than ask them if they would like an add-on and have them initiate the add-on with a tick? I am truly disappointed that this is how they operate.

Short flight from Singapore to Kuching, midday flight on a Sunday. Flight was more than 50% empty, so obviously the overall experience was better. Boarding was on time and efficient, and crew were reasonably pleasant. For this short flight, I had paid for the first row of seats, and so legroom was aplenty. The A320 had obviously seen quite a lot of service, seats were clean but felt like the cushions had sagged a little. Halfway through the flight, was impressed that inflight connectivity (rokki) allowed reading of the AirAsia inflight magazine, brief travel guides, news and simple games on iPad, all for free. Impressive for a no-frills airline. Flight landed on time, and disembarkation was fuss free. If seat comfort was a tad better, this would be a 5-star low-cost airline flight.

route: Hyderabad to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hyderabad to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. Because of delay of flight from Hyderabad we missed connecting flight and received a poor response from AirAsia staff in Malaysia airport

route: Denpasar to Hong Kong via Bangkok
review: Denpasar to Hong Kong via Bangkok. This is my first time flying with Air Asia. I was apprehensive of the questionable standard since it's a budget airline which gives the bare minimum, but get you from A to B. I took the plunge and tried to return to Hong Kong from Bali with it. It was operated by Thai Air Asia. I booked fly+bag+eat combo, sat on front row seat. Check in at Bali airport was friendly and efficient. I am happy to report that the experience had been very positive. Crew were courteous and smiling. Ordered meals were promptly delivered, and it actually tasted ok. I like the fact that Air Asia makes no qualm about bringing outside food and drink on board for own consumption. Seat was bound in leather, well padded and comfortable for the 4 hour journey. There was a lay over of 2 hours in Bangkok old airport Don Muang, it was welcoming as one could stretch the legs and do some shopping, or eat a good meal before the 2nd leg. The same good standard of service continued for the next flight back home. I was able to check my bags through from bali to Hong Kong. Transit process was very simple and direction crystal clear. Upon arrival, my bags were one of the first to come out. The fly bag eat combo actually do include priority luggage, a really nice touch. I also noticed that the 2 flights left and arrived on time. Based on the good experience, I will not hesitate to fly with them again in future.

I had the best customer experience on this AirAsia flight flying from Manila to Cebu on 4th  September. Excellent inflight service and entertainment for the guests. Pleasant music played throughout the journey, food was very good plus an hitherto unseen entertainment for guests on flight. The airhostess(two of them) woke us all up by their energetic dance performance. This was followed by a quiz. Correct answers were awarded with AirAsia goodies. Perfect holiday experience.

Semarang to Kuala Lumpur. The flight departed from the new International airport in Semarang, which was great. Self-check in machines are available, which can cut down queue lines. Nevertheless, the line to queue to the plane was quite unmanageable.

Kuala Lumpur to Semarang. I was able to checked in earlier, 2 weeks before the departure time. The flight was on time from KL to Semarang, and apparently arrived 10 minutes earlier. Stewards were friendly to the passengers. It was a good flight for low-cost airline.

I missed my connecting flight from Kuala Lumpur to Penang, my own fault, reported my situation and was advised how to book next connecting flight and organise my retrieval of luggage, looking totally confused, I hastily took off to correct my mistake, hopefully. An agent caught up with me and explained it would be quicker and easier for him to organise.  He returned after a short period, having had to run from Gate K to Gate J and return with both my boarding pass and luggage ticket. I was so grateful as he had taken the initiative to go far and beyond his duties to fix my problem. This person should be highly recommended for advancement in the company as he put the company first for customer service which was so appreciated.

Phuket to Hanoi via Bangkok. I wasn’t sure about AirAsia at first, but we had absolutely no problem. I am scared to fly, but it was a smooth ride. No food or entertainment provided, which was fine as it was under 2 hours flight. I would definitely fly again.

Kunming to Bangkok. I booked my ticket with them well in advance and also pre-purchased baggage as it is cheaper to do so. I realized my ticket would be non-refundable if I had to cancel this flight, but I expected them to grant a credit with the airline for future flights. But they refused to refund any amount, even the baggage fees, and didn't grant any credit for future flights. This level of customer service is appalling.

route: Bangkok to Ho Chi Minh City
review: Bangkok to Ho Chi Minh City. What a joke. My friend and I bought ticket together under 1 transaction. Airline let us sit separately when checked in. Reason: all seats are full. We bought ticket 4 months in advance. When they heard that they asked us to request the in-flight attendant. Of couse that didn't work and we ended up sitting separately. Bottom line: don't buy this airline if you travel in group.

route: Hyderabad to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hyderabad to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. My flight scheduled at 11.50 pm and it delayed by 3.5 hours. I have a transit of 2.5hrs in Malaysia and need to catch flight to Melbourne which I can’t catch due to this delay. When I ask the counter person about the connecting flight they said the next connecting flight will be in 2.5 hrs after I landed in Malaysia. But when I went to transfer counter in Malaysia they said the next connecting flight is after 12hrs and gave me couple of meal vouchers. Obviously very poor customer service and most unreliable. Counter people are useless as they don’t have knowledge of the flight schedule. I requested them for  lounge entry which they rejected to give. I have spent $100 to book a room in the airport. Should reach Melbourne 8.00 pm local time and I reached next day morning 8.00 am and took day off from my work.

route: Ho Chi Minh City to Phuket via Bangkok
review: Ho Chi Minh City to Phuket via Bangkok. My round trip flight should have cost me $130. But I ended up spending a total of $270 because they charged me to check my bag twice. They charged me $40 to check my bag from Saigon to Bangkok (a 3 hour layover) and then $57 from Bangkok to Phuket. They said they couldn’t let my bag go all the way to Phuket from Saigon for some odd reason.  Do yourself a favor and avoid.

Ranchi to New Delhi. Good service. Even though its a lost cost airline but the service was good. Professional staff and well mannered. Aircraft was pretty neat and clean with good aroma through out the journey.

Langkawi to Kuala Lumpur. My last experience with AirAsia was way back in 2012 to Sabah. This time, for a 1 hour flight I could say that I'm quite impressed. Ground service was good, even though I used self check in, staff assisted me in putting on my baggage tag. They redirected me smoothly and was quite helpful when I encountered a problem. This time around, I took this opportunity to survey on "Allstars", something which AirAsia is proud about and I wanted to see it for myself. Upon boarding, flight attendant greeted warmly, safety procedures were done (flight attendant did not smile, at least she looks serious), one passenger made a fuss and the stewardess handled it quickly and efficiently. Flight experience was good, take-off was smooth and views were fantastic. Even saw a rainbow for a moment over the clouds! I pre-ordered a meal and when I had some left over, they offered to tapao (take away) for me! Kudos for the Malaysian slang. Had two kids sitting next to me, so I helped them fasten their seatbelts, steward thanked me with a smile(I did not expect that!) Unfortunately, Roki was not working so in flight entertainment is boring. Landing was good, flight on time and had 2 captains for that flight. Overall experience was amazing for an LCC. Highly recommended!

Bangkok to Hat Yai, it´s a cheap and low cost airline, I have to say the ground staff and the cabin crew was every time really polite and friendly. Of course there are not many amenities or complimentary services but for the price I paid, the only thing which should be improved is the legroom space, this was really narrow, but this was ok for a two hours flight.

Kuala Lumpur to Bali. As usual, online check-in for Airasia is available, until the last 24 hours before the flight. Departing to the flight is seamless and ground staff were helpful. When the plane leaving the aerobridge, there were some passengers that still stand at aisle and not on their seat, and pretty sure that is dangerous. During the flight, staff were really friendly and helpful. There were some turbulence during the flight, but no big deal. However, pre-booked meal that I had was terrible. Spiral pasta with sausages was plain and sad. Not recommended.

As a low-cost airline AirAsia has no entertainment and food or drink should be paid on the flight. I found the leg space insufficient for a person who is 5’10” or more. I hope AirAsia provides better services to customers in the near future.

Kuala Lumpur to Manila. The first flight to Malaysia was fine, no problems. The return to Manila was terrible! I am 6' 2" and I had no clearance for my knees.  This was not a planned trip. I have been in Philippines for 3 years and had to leave, for a silly rule. and come back again, so it was just a quick trip, away and back. For an international flight the seat configuration was uncalled for.

Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Self check-in machines are not available across the airport, but it is only available in the Airasia check-in counter section, which requires a bit of walking. This same goes to the boarding gate which is quite far. I hope Airasia could get a better spot of it.

Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. Check-in went well, as there are many self check-in machines in the KLIA2 airport. Boarding was relatively on-time and there was no issue. The best part is when landing in Jakarta, since Airasia is now operating in the new airport where they provide better services.

Very disappointed with Air Asia as a frequent flyer after last experience. Online check-in had errors and glitches which did not allow me to checkin early, charged 40,000 yen at airport. Showed pictures of website glitches and errors, airline does not care or understand. Then I was accidentally tripled charged on my return flight baggage. Had 5 transactions for baggage totaling over $800 USD! My two tickets cost only around $700. Was refunded for some of the excess charges, however such a hassle and online help and calling is very time consuming and stressful and not user friendly. I figured if I provided pictures and explained my problems the airline would understand the online checkin and website had experienced problems and was not working properly. Poor customer service using live chat and submitting cases on issues, just replied back with automated answers. Like talking to a computer. Nobody should have to get charged over $800 USD and worry about 5 charges for 2 small check-in bags, especially unauthorized charges. Very disappointed and will never fly again because of airlines poor recognition of the problem, poor customer service and failure to refund a small cost that should never of happened. Nobody should have to go through that stress while on vacation!

Bangkok to Kuala Lumpur. As usual, Air Asia is a serious and comfortable company. The prices are very interesting, I have always used this company for 10 years from Bangkok to different destinations in Asia. I have never known any problems, continue like that, thank you. FR: Comme d'habitude, Air Asia est une compagnie sérieuse et confortable. Les prix proposés sont très intéressant, j'utilise toujours depuis 10 ans cette compagnie depuis Bangkok vers différentes destinations en Asie. Je n'ai jamais connu le moindre problèmes, continuer comme cela, merci.

Kuala Namu to Kuala Lumpur. As usual, Air Asia always provide smooth experience without any hassle from check-in until departure. However, Airasia is now implemented a strict 7kg policy where cabin baggage has to be strictly only up to 7kg, or else it would be charge expensively.

On the 5th June I travelled on Air Asia from Kuala Lumpur to Colombo. The plane was an Airbus 320 and very comfortable. I was able to get a lot of rest during the 3.5 hour flight. I had three seats to myself.

On the 21st June I had a flight on Air Asia from Colombo to Kuala Lumpur. It was a red eye flight and we arrived around 5am in the morning. I had to clear customs although I had a flight on Air Asia in the evening. The time went very quickly so it must have been a good flight. I was able to stretch out and get some rest.

Hong Kong to Kuala Lumpur. Very good experience, bought the premium flex package and still cheaper than other airline e.g. Cathay Dragon. Also you can enjoy a better flight experience than the traditional airline. The lounge is good too. It is a good place for you the relax.

An hour flight with AirAsia was pretty worth it. Boarding of the plane was smooth. Stewards were really friendly and the pre-booked meal that I had which was Green Thai Curry was okay. But Nasi Lemak and Chicken Rice is way better. Overall, good experience from a low-cost airlines by AirAsia as usual.

My flight with AirAsia was from Singapore to Penang. Boarding was slow but we reached Penang before the scheduled arrival time. Cabin crew were friendly and were eager in helping passengers but they could have shown more warmth by smiling more. Seat was okay. Overall, the flight with AirAsia was a good one.

Surabaya to Kuala Lumpur. As what I am expected from AirAsia low-cost airlines, decent service and flight are always present in the whole experience. The time of flight departure is quite accurate.
